column1: bowls a length ball that slants in, he gets a good stride in and defends
swing and a miss! Looks to slap this over cover, beaten by the late movement.
this is another cracker! Angles in and then leaves him after pitching. Beaten as this bounces over off stump
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone.
excellent delivery! Beaten on the drive, minimal feet movement again.
in the slot to drive, this time he's happy to leave
back of length angling in from around the stumps, goes right back into the crease and defends

his first Test innings is shortlived! This is a sensational catch at second slip. This is a short of length ball that nips away to square him up, pushes hard at this to get a thick edge. This may have been dying on the first slip fielder, but Holder went across by diving low to his right from second slip to complete a stunner.
Back of length on middle, he hops back and defends

Not in control, but he'll get off the mark. Fetches this pull from outside off, hits the top part of the bat and skews away towards square leg. Looked like he wanted to hit it further in front of square, through midwicket.
Full on off, squeezed to the cover fielder
Driven through the line to extra cover
back of a length outside off, and zipping past the batsman's tentative defensive shot. Tries to punch it straight, but the ball went just past the edge of the bat
big appeal for caught behind, but the umpire's not interested. Length ball on off, and taking some extra bounce after pitching. Squares the batsman up as he tries to defend off the back foot
sees width and looks to belt this on the up over cover, beaten!
inward movement from length outside off, left alone this time
another drive, another miss. Nice shape from outside off, this was overpitched and there for the drive, but he was late on the stroke.
poke and a miss. He's batting on a different planet today. Tried hard, hasn't found the edge yet. Beauty of a delivery, lifts from length on off to square him up as he pushes at it.
back of length delivery outside off, Dhananjaya leaves
right behind the line of this length delivery as he defends with soft hands.
full and swinging away from the fifth stump, left alone
angles it full outside off from wide of the crease, left alone
shows the full face of the bat as he blunts this full delivery with bat close to the pad.
short, there's width to go for the slap through cover point if he wants, but Dhananjaya leaves.
pacy length delivery but he got the direction wrong. Angling down leg, left alone

what is Kusal doing? One of the most strange Test knocks I've seen in a while. No clue about this! Roach slips in a full ball that bends back in late, Kusal looks to jam his bat down to keep it out, but realises this may have not done enough and leaves. Brave leave too.
shapes to drive, the ball bends back in to roll off a thick inside edge towards midwicket. Once again, no control of his strokes. Just pushing half-heartedly at deliveries.
bowls this far too wide outside off, looked like it slipped out of his hand. There's stiff breeze too. Left alone
full and wide outside off, moving away off the deck, left alone
peach that holds its line after pitching on length around off, he played inside the line as this whizzed past the outside edge
full and wide outside off, this time left alone with confidence.
short of length outside off, Dhananjaya gets on top of the bounce and eases this into the gap between cover and point. Lovely
slashed away, this one flies up and over the slip cordon to the third man boundary.
hustled for pace as he hops back into the crease to defend this incoming length delivery.

played on! Not only does he have to walk back, but will have to nurse a potential injury. He's down on the floor as this one thudded into his right elbow and then bounced into the stumps. Beaten for pace as this jagged back sharply to hit him. The physio is out to attend to him and immediately puts on an ice pack as Dhananjaya walks back. Nasty stuff. Brilliant from West Indies. Proper Test-match bowling. Talk about being unlucky upon comeback.
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends.
Slashed to squirt this through the gully region to the third man boundary, off the mark in streaky fashion
full and swinging back in from wide of the crease, this started around middle so went further down, excellent take by Dowrich as he dived full stretch.
is it the breeze that's disturbing his rhythm? Slips another delivery down leg, left alone.
full and swinging away from way outside off, left alone
swish and a miss. Chased another full delivery, only to be beaten by late swing.
goes for another drive but is late on it, beaten.
full on off, there for the drive. This time there's authority in his leave.
jabs hard at this length ball angling in, up in the air for a while but lands safely, away from forward shortleg
lifter outside off, Mendis hops back as he bunts this towards gully.
play and a miss. Short of length outside off, looks to arch back and steer it over.
poor ball, too short outside off, he hops back and punches this behind square on the off side. Races to the square third man boundary. In total control.
back of length delivery outside off, left alone.
squeezes an off drive back to the bowler
woah! Bounce that troubles Kusal again. Lifts from short of length on middle to hit him on the elbow off an inside edge.
short of length but well down leg, he ducks under it
works this off the pads to square leg.
short of length but well down leg, lets it go
gets him on the glove as he jabs , lands just short of gully. Once again surprised by the pace and bounce. Wincing in pain as well. This one nipped back in sharply from the deck.
right behind the line as he defends this time.
hops back and defends this gentle length ball outside off
not in control as he fetches this pull from outside off, gets it past square leg
punches this away-going length ball to cover as he scampers a single
angling into middle and leg, tucked towards square leg
draws the edge, but lands short of gully
pulled but not in control again, plonks where a midwicket would be.
angling into his pads, and clipped off his toes to the vacant mid-wicket region
length ball outside off, and seaming away after pitching. Left alone by Mendis
back of a length outside off, and Mendis rides the bounce this time to fend it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, and soaring way over Mendis. He's happy to let it go

full outside off, and takes the shoulder of Mendis' bat as he tries to shoulder his arms. Was in two minds - whether to drive or not - and eventually pulls out of any shot. The ball, however, takes an edge off his bat and bounces down to the slip cordon
good length on off, and Mendis covers his off-stump line before pushing it towards the off side
length ball on middle, and he tries to punch it towards cover. The ball's too close to his body, and comes off the top-half of his bat. Sliced to point
length ball, but wider outside off. Perera tiptoes, and then slaps it furiously past the point region. Jayasuriya-esque

in the air for ages, but falls just beyond Bishoo! Holder came around the wicket, and dropped the ball short. Perera tried to cut, but slices it over point. Bishoo, at point, runs towards the delivery, but the ball falls just outside his reach. Close
back of a length outside off, and going through to Dowrich. Left alone this time
length ball on off, and Perera gets onto the back foot and meets the ball in front of his eyes. Punched to the bowler
full on off, and zipping into his pads. Tries to flick it towards square leg, but the ball goes between bat and body. Hits his back leg, but impact's too high. Drinks as well
back of a length, but seaming away from Mendis. He offers no shot
length ball outside off, and takes some extra spice after pitching! Soars past the batsman's off stump and into Dowrich's gloves
length ball outside off, and seaming further away. Left alone
full outside off, and Mendis prods forward - towards the pitch of the ball - but then sees the ball through into Dowrich's pads. Not playing at anything too far away
full outside off, and it's that length that'll tempt you to drive. But Mendis doesn't get enticed. Shoulders his arms
length ball outside off, and seams slightly in after pitching. Mendis tiptoes and slaps this past the point region. He'll collect two
length ball angling into Perera's body, and he shuffles across to the off side before pulling it down the ground. Controlled shot, past square leg, and the ball races away for a boundary
full outside off, and this time he cuts it in front of square. Played in front of his body, and caresses this cut-drive through the covers. Timed beautifully

overpitched on off, and drilled down the ground! In the slot to be sent away, and that's what Perera does. Hit so hard that he almost took the non-striker's feet with him to the boundary. Mendis did well to skip out of the ball's way
nice comeback ball! Back of a length on middle, and angling across the batsman's body. Tries to defend off the back foot, but the ball whizzes past his edge
full on off, and zoots off the surface! Goes to Dowrich very high on this occasion
length ball on off, and going across his body. Left alone to see the over off
back of a length on off, and he rocks back onto the back foot to defend
full outside off, and once again takes some extra bounce after pitching. Spicy bounce, and the ball goes zipping through to Dowrich
back of a length on off, and straightens after pitching. Squares Mendis up slightly, but he manages to defend it towards point in the end
full, and outside off stump. Left alone
length ball outside off, and first signs of low bounce. Stays low as it goes through to Dowrich on the bounce
back of a length, and this one gets big on Mendis. He's forced to rock back, and fend it with soft hands
width offered, and Perera ain't missing these out any more. Stays on the back foot, and cuts this over the fielder at point for a boundary. He's found his footing now
almost chopped on! Tries to cut it past point once again, but the ball's too full and too close to his body. Comes off his bat's inside-half, but is lucky that it doesn't ricochet onto his off stump
full, and lands on off stump. Perera gets to the pitch of the ball - covering his offstump - and then lets it go
length ball outside off, but once again taking some extra bounce off the surface. Boomerang bounce through to Dowrich
full on off, and he tries to drive straight. Check-drives, really, and the ball takes an inside edge. It rolls away towards square leg, so short leg goes chasing after it
full just outside off, and angling away from Perera. An easy choice to see the over out
length ball outside off, but angling into Mendis. He shuffles towards the leg side to make some extra room, and then pushes it towards cover point
full, and lands on off stump, Mendis steps forward and drives back to Cummins
length ball outside off, and enough room for Mendis to attempt the cut. He backed away, and had a proper swing of the bat as well, but the ball flies over the top of his bat's edge
back of a length on off, and Mendis chooses to fend it away off the back foot
length ball on off, but angling into his body. Tries to flick it behind square on the leg side, but can't connect. The ball rises and hits his thigh
length ball outside off, and goes through to the keeper's gloves without any trouble
back of a length on off, and he tiptoes and cuts it over the infield. Enough power behind that shot to clear point, but not hit well enough for it to find the boundary
nice line! Length ball on middle, and just going past the top of off stump to the keeper
length ball on off, and zipping into his body. Tries to nudge it to square leg, but the ball comes off the bat's inside half. Trickles down to short fine leg instead
length ball on off, and he rides the bounce to turn it off his chest to the leg side. Played with soft hands

thinks about playing at it, but lets it go after seeing the ball too close to his body. Was a length delivery outside off, which made Mendis think about playing a punch towards cover. Pulls his bat back in time though
full, and outside off stump. Straightens after pitching, and finds itself in the hands of the keeper

out first ball! Edges it to third slip. Uses the angle to force the ball to come in, and Perera fends at it tentatively. No real footwork either, and the ball takes the edge off the bat's shoulder and goes straight to Holder in the cordon
full, but wide outside off. Seams further away and Chandimal lets it go
full on leg stump, and whipped off his toes to the deep backward square leg boundary
full just outside off, and entices Mendis to drive. He's through his shot too early, and the ball goes just past the outside of his bat

full outside off, and driven square off the front foot. Played with the angled bat, so places the ball between point and cover point. But a committed effort from Bishoo stops the ball from leaking through
full outside off, but no real bounce this time. Mendis shoulders his arms and the ball goes into Dowrich's gloves
length ball on middle, and going wildly down the leg side. Dowrich puts in a Superman dive to his left to stop the ball
full on leg, and turned off his toes to the fielder at deep backward square leg. Enough time to jog back for the second
back of a length outside off, but jagging inwards sharply. Chandimal sticks his bat out, pokes at the ball, and taps it towards cover point off the back foot

mistimed over the umpire! Almost took the ump's head off, there. Full outside off, and he attempts the straight drive. Through his shot a bit too early, so the ball comes off the top-half of his bat. Still got enough power behind that shot, to go towards the on-side, and find the mid-on boundary for four more
length ball outside off, and he tries to play the late cut. Too close to his body, so it's been mistimed to short third man
back of a length on middle, and tries to cramp Mendis for room. But he shuffles across to the off side, and deflects this off his pads down Dowrich's left. No stopping that...
length ball outside off, and continues to angle in after pitching. Chandimal shoulders his arms, but the ball was perilously close to the top of off stump. A well-judged leave you'd say
full on off, and really does zip off after pitching. Chandimal came forward to defend, but the ball moves in, and goes between bat and pad. How that did not hit leg stump?
yorker on leg, and that's been comfortably turned off his toes to the vacant square-leg region. Gets off strike

back of a length outside off, but angling into Mendis. He tries to cut, but the ball stays low. Too close to him as well, and therefore the delivery goes past the inside of his bat, and through to Dowrich on the bounce. Could've easily chopped that on as well
almost caught and bowled! But lands just short of Roach. Full on off, and Mendis drives straight. Slices it slightly, so the ball's in the air for a bit. But lands just in front of Roach
back of a length on off, and blocked off the back foot. A menacing over from Roach
full on middle, and tapped off the front foot with the bat's closing face to midwicket. No chance of a single
length ball outside off, and takes the bat's inside edge as Chandimal tries to punch. Too close to his body, and the ball goes to fine leg instead
back of a length on off, and he goes onto the back foot. Fended with soft hands
full outside off, and he goes for an extravagant cover drive. Gets to the pitch of the ball, but can't connect with the shot. The ball sways away after pitching, and Mendis misses out on the drive
full on off, and Mendis carefully blocks this away off the front foot. The delivery was aimed at his stumps

length ball outside off, and once again finds Mendis' bat despite him trying to shoulder his arms. Too slow to get his bat out of the ball's way, and so the delivery takes the bottom of his bat and rolls away to the slip cordon
good length on middle, rocks back and punches it to the cover region
flatter, and lands on off stump. This is the one that goes straight through, so Chandimal punches it away off the back foot
length ball outside off, and spins further after pitching. Played off the back foot to cover once more
flighted on off, and Chandimal wants to play the drive. Jams his shot, though, and the ball is bottom-edged back to Bishoo
flighted full outside off, and defended off the front foot to the covers
flat, and wide outside off. Chandimal gets onto the backfoot, and then cuts it past the point region to the man in the deep
length ball outside off, and Chandimal sticks his bat out. The ball pings his bat, and trickles away to the point region
full, and on off stump. Chandimal attempts the drive, but his shot finds the bat's inside edge, and ricochets onto his boots
back of a length, and really does bend his back this time. Goes down the leg side, unfortunately, for West Indies
full on off, and pushed off the front foot to mid off. No run.
full outside off, and that's been tentatively pushed towards cover. Played between the two infielders, and so Chandimal calls for the single

the keeper tips it over! Chance of a catch, and what a way to go to lunch. Short ball outside off, and Mendis attempted to ramp it over slip. Edges it, and it's flying over Dowrich's head, but the keeper jumped as high as he could and tried to take the catch, but alas. Dowrich gloves it over his head, and the ball goes to the boundary line. Sri Lanka on 79 for 3
full and swinging away from outside off, left alone
gets this to nip back in from outside off, good leave by Chandi. The ball dipped on Dowrich, who fumbled as they take a bye
goes back into the crease and dabs this gently towards gully
right back into the crease as he punches this to gully again
draws the edge as he floats this full on off, lands short of gully this time.
confident forward push to a delivery angling in, safely defended
angling into the pads, clipped away nicely past midwicket
short of length on off stump, he stands tall and plays this with soft hands
delightful backfoot punch into the gap at extra cover. Picked the length early, transferred weight back to play
play and a miss. Wafts at a delivery outside off without any conviction
squirted through gully, Chase gives it chase, manages to pull it back

Devon Smith has put down a sitter at first slip! This should've been swallowed, as a slip fielder, you can't ask for a more straightforward catch. Angles in from length, holds its line to square Chandimal as he jabs hard, flew at a comfortable height too. Oh, dear. What's worse? It races to the third man boundary. Replays indicate this just wobbled away a wee bit from Smith
mistimes a forceful stroke on the legside to mid-on
gift of a delivery. Half-volley on the pads and he whips this uppishly to the square leg boundary. Too easy
full on off stump from wide of the crease, driven to mid-off
squeezes this straight drive over the bowler's head on the bounce, mid-off runs back to cut that off
direct hit at the striker's end and this would've been close. Hesitation in the running as Kusal punches this to Bishoo and takes off.
sliced past him! Played outside the line as this angled in and beat the inside edge. Kept a touch low as well.
poke and a miss! Gets this to nip away from length outside off, he played at that with an angled bat. Fraught with danger
beauty again! Angles in at length on off and straightens a wee bit as Kusal Mendis plays inside the line, whizzed past the outside edge
angles in full on middle and leg, defended.
jaffa! Squared up again, not far from the edge. At the moment, Kusal is skating on thin ice
looks to play, decides to leave late. Very, very good decision. Superb length from Miguel, right up there, allowing the ball to move and cause indecision
full and wide outside off, there for the drive but left alone
angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, left alone
nips away from length on fifth stump, left alone
lifter that angles in and causes some discomfort, Chandimal is authoritative in his leave. Flies to the keeper
lovely! This is angled full, but by no means an overpitched delivery. Chandimal is drawn forward as he pokes but sees the ball just do enough to beat the edge
right on top of the bounce as he bunts this to point, Chase with a wild throw at the non-striker's end to concede four overthrows as the mid-on fielder wasn't backing up.
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends.
left alone and done quite well. Keeper had to leap to collect this over his head.
short of length but far too wide to get the batsman playing, Chandimal shoulders arms
another short of length delivery outside off, left alone
pace, bounce and zip. Chandimal somehow had to arch back to avoid playing that, flew to the keeper.
back of length outside off, watched through to the keeper
hustled for pace as he hops back to defend, this raps him on the glove and lobs, but there's no short leg
full and wide outside off, there for the drive but he lets it go.
angles in a length ball from wide of the crease, defended
looked to lift over mid-on but this flew off a thick inside edge over midwicket, dribbles over the ropes.
neat forward defense to a full delivery on off stump
magnificent! Full and angling in, he shows the full face of the bat in lofting this up and over mid-on.
picks the length early and pulls this wide of midwicket
right back into the crease as he defends this length ball with soft hands
right forward as he eases this full delivery into the covers
looked to pull, then duck but this short of length ball hurried in to have him awkwardly fending, rolled away to fine leg
right on top of the bounce as he bunts this towards point for a quick single
full and sliding down, helped along to fine leg
awkward bounce but he controls this lifter nicely, rolls to gully.
sees this short, looks to thrash this cut but is beaten
back into the crease as he defends this short of length delivery with soft hands
there for the drive but he lets it go
invites the drive by pitching it up, Kusal happy to leave
right forward as he defends the full delivery angling in.
curves away from outside off, length much fuller again, left alone
works this length ball off his hip to fine leg
slashes to get this up and over the slips, no third man so that's four
there was leg slip placed strategically, but he'll see this just elude him. Chandimal tickles this flick uppishly to the fine leg boundary. Bishoo was nearly in business
back of length that moves away off the seam from outside off, left alone.
squared up as he squirts this length ball to point
snorter of a delivery headed towards those fingers of Chandimal as he hops back and blunts this

a screamer from the keeper! What a welcome to my commentary stint. Goes short on middle, and cramps Mendis for room. He tries to pull, but top-edges the shot. The leading edge goes far - almost as far as the deep midwicket boundary - but Dowrich keeps his eyes on the ball and completes a running catch that was always going away from him. Breaks a stubborn partnership
length ball on middle, and tapped off his pads to the vacant square-leg region
full outside off, and shapes away after pitching. Roshen comes forward to drive but then doesn't push at the moving ball. Left alone to Dowrich
full on off, and Roshen's quick to spot the length. Comes forward and drives with soft hands to cover
good length on middle, and he attempts to flick it to the leg side. Extra bounce makes him miss the shot, and the ball hits the top of his front leg

full on off, and it's that temptlng driving length. He plays the straight drive, and the ball takes a thick outside edge, but the shot sneaks between first and second slip. Boundary to get off the mark
length ball on middle, and that's been whipped off his hips to deep backward square leg. Enough time to jog back for second
short and wide outside off. Chandimal stands tall, and slaps this over point. Not timed very well, but enough behind that shot to clear point. No one in the deep, and that's a safe boundary shot
length ball on off, and Chandimal taps it off the front foot towards point
back of a length on middle, and Chandimal uses his wrists to steer this behind square on the leg side. Gets off strike
good length outside off, and takes a smokin' bounce off the pitch! Rises, and gets too close to the outside of Roshen's back-foot defense. Squares him up and then whizzes past the outside of his bat

pace and bounce! Proper fourth-stump line from Cummins. Takes off after pitching, and once again the batsman does well to keep his bat inside the line of the ball. So close to taking the outside edge. Over
full outside off, and swinging away from Chandimal. He doesn't choose to drive
back of a length outside off, and holding its shape as it sways away from the batsman. Shoulders his arms this time
good length on middle, and tapped off the backfoot to the empty spots near midwicket. They scamper across for one
full on off, and defended with soft hands towards cover. Plays it with his eyes on top of the ball
full just outside off, and straightens after pitching. Roshen's not tempted though, lets it go through to Dowrich
full, and just outside off stump. Roshen sees the over off by shouldering his arms
length ball on middle, and that's been nudged off his hips to the sweeper fielder on the leg side
chests this away! Owww. Length ball outside off, but angling sharply inwards. Roshen tried to shoulder his arms, but the ball jags in and hits him on the chest. He seems fine though
length ball on off, and turned off his waist to the leg side. Deflects it to midwicket
yorker on middle, and Roshen manages to squeeze this away down the leg side. Fine leg cleans up this time
good length outside off, but angling in sharply. Swings into the batsman, but only after passing his bat. Drinks
starts after the break with a full ball. Lands just outside off, and the batsman meets it on the front foot. Played to cover
full just outside off, and driven with soft hands to the short cover region
full, but wider outside off. Shaping further away, and left alone by Chandimal
back of a length on middle, and doing down the leg side. Chandimal tries to clip it off his pads, but the ball goes beyond him. Stopped by the diving wicketkeeper
length ball outside off, and jags in late! Chandimal misses his front-foot punch, and the ball is inside-edged to the leg side
full on off, and that's aimed on off stump. Roshen prods forward and blocks it back to Holder

back of a length outside off, and that's been cut off the back foot. He's in the air while playing the shot, and is therefore not balanced at all. Slices this shot almost into the hands of the substitute fielder at point
back of a length on off, and that's been clipped with the angle to the fielder at square leg. Enough time to scamper across for one
full on middle, and that's been clipped off his pads to the leg side. Stopped by the fielder at square leg, though
back of a length outside off, and he punches at this from near his face. Mistimes the shot, as it hits the top of his bat. Falls just short of the fielder poaching in front of point
length ball outside off, but soaring away thereafter. The ball was always rising, and Chandimal judges well to leave this ball

full on leg stump, and that's been comfortably tapped off his pads. Plays it in front of square, and nudges it with such soft hands that the ball doesn't even go to the boundary. A lot of running to do for the duo
full outside off, and that's been confidently driven off the front foot. Off the bat's sweet spot, but can't penetrate the off-side infield
length ball just outside off, and goes through after pitching, to the keeper. Shoulders his arms this time
fuller, and lands just outside off. Pushed off the front foot, and played back to Holder
full on off, and he comes forward to drive this to the mid-off fielder
length ball on middle, and that's been tapped off the front foot to the non-striker
overpitched on leg stump, and that's been played to the midwicket boundary. Once again played with gentle hands, so the fielder at midwicket has to go chasing behind it. Fifty as well!
length ball on middle, and flicked off his hips to square leg. Man there, and Bishoo's dive stops the ball. Saves the run
length ball on off, and Roshen rides the bounce before defending it with the bat's open face. Played to cover point
length ball on leg stump, and Roshen pushes at this off the back foot. Played to mid on
good length outside off, and Roshen gets to the pitch of the ball before shouldering his arms
good length outside off, and Roshen considers cutting this square. Eventually offers no shot
full outside off, and left alone by the batsman. Proper bending of the back from Gabriel - 140kph to end the over
length ball on off, legbreak. Blocked off the back foot
flat just outside off, and Chandimal rocks back to cut it square. No turn this time, so the ball ended up being too close to the batsman. Finds point
length ball on middle, and cramps the batsman for room. Blocked off the back foot
googly! Length ball on off, but turns inwards. Chandimal goes to the legside, and punches to mid off
full on off, and he defends this flighted delivery to the off side
full on off, and he comes dancing down the wicket to drive it straight. Stopped by Bishoo, though

edged to third slip! Safe hands of Jason Holder. Extra bounce from back of a length, and the ball gets big on Roshen. He tries to defend from near his face, but the ball pops out, takes the shoulder of Roshen's bat, and then goes straight into the bucket-hands of the West Indies captain. Sri Lanka lose their fifth
length ball outside off, and left alone first up
length ball outside off, and Dickwella goes poking after it. Taps it to the third-slip fielder
full outside off, and he throws his hands at this. Drives through the covers, and collects a couple to get off the mark
back of a length outside off, and going further away from the batsman. Dickwella drops his gloves and sees the ball through to Dowrich
back of a length outside off, and left alone once again by Dickwella. Opts not to go chasing after this
drifts in a full delivery on the stumps, defended back
steps out to drive, this is too full so he squeezes back to the bowler
shows the full face to ease this back to the bowler again
full and drifting in, worked into the gap at midwicket
good stride forward as he defends this full delivery
eases this tossed up delivery to mid-on
wafts at a length ball outside off, deviates from a crack to beat the edge
jabs this full delivery with the bat well in front of his body, lobbed briefly but well short of cover.
squirts this full delivery into the covers.
hops back and bunts this short of length delivery towards the gully region
plays inside the line of this short of length delivery as it whizzes past.
right behind the line of this length ball as he defends.
eases this tossed up delivery back to the bowler
dabs this indrifter on length to cover
touch short and spinning away, left alone
good stride forward as he defends
squeezes this yorker-length delivery back to the bowler
fired full and flat on off stumps, pushed to cover
swish and a miss. Looking to flay this on the up through point, late on the stroke.
flirts with danger again, wafting at a length ball that nips away sharply to beat the edge.
beauty! Angles in to square him up and then deviates a wee bit to whizz past the shoulder of the blade
length outside off, left alone
at the moment, this is one-way traffic. Beaten on the drive again. Dickwella clueless
this length ball nips back in from outside off, Dickwella, I assume, played for this to leave him. No damage done
defends back this tossed up delivery
spins away from outside off, left alone
fired full and flat, blocked
drifts in full on middle, squeezed back
full on off, he lunges forward and smothers this
driven nicely to the cover fielder
full outside off, defended towards the covers
oh, dear. What are you doing, Niroshan? Flashes at a short of length delivery outside off, beaten. Too close to the body.
right on top of the bounce as he bunts this behind square on the leg side
back of length outside off, not enough to get the batsman playing, left alone.
shoulders arms to a length ball angling in from wide of the crease.
hops back and punches this length delivery to cover
sharp turn from outside off, he's right back into the crease as he defends.
gets a good stride in as he keeps that out
slow turn from length outside off, punched to long on
drifts in a quicker ball on middle, defended back
gets this to dip on the batsman, nice loop because he slowed it down, left alone by Chandi
touch short, he goes back and defends to short cover
nice flight, lands on off, defended
drifts in from wide of the crease, defended with soft hands with bat well in front of the pad
paddled nicely towards deep fine leg
premeditated paddle that he misses, the ball drifts in to strike the pad but the impact was outside off
eases this flighted delivery back to Chase
shapes to drive but can't quite get to the pitch as it dipped on him, mistimed towards cover point
past the diving mid-on fielder. Driven back off an inside edge, wanted to place this between cover and mid-off.
slow turn back in from around the stumps, defended back
stretches out and eases into the off side
makes room and punches to cover, wanted the single but is sent back
sharp turn from off, defends from the crease
googly but this is short, enough time for him to go back into the crease and defend. That's tea
back of a length on off, and worked off his hips to the fielder at deep backward square leg. They jog across for one
length ball on off, and zooting across the batsman's body. He tries to poke at it but pulls his bat back
good length on leg stump, and Dickwella backs away to make some room. Scythes it away to point
back of a length on leg stump, and tapped off the back foot to the vacant square-leg region. They sneak through for one
short! Lands on middle, but going down the leg side. Chandimal flicks it fine off his pads for a walking single
back of a length on middle, but Dickwella fends it with soft hands. Drops the ball near his toes
length ball outside off, and Chandimal chop-punches this to cover. The lack of bounce takes him by surprise
length ball angling into his body, and Chandimal turns this off his hips to the leg side. Comfortably walk across for one
length ball on off, and tapped off the back foot to point
full on off, and driven down the ground. Mistimed, though, and intercepted by mid off
length ball on off, and punched away from his body through the covers. Chase for the infielder, but he manages to parry it back
length ball outside off, and shoulders his arms on this occasion. Sees the over out in a safe manner
awry! Short, and down the leg side. Dowrich does terribly well to shuffle across to his right and intercept this ball from over his head
good length outside off. Rising delivery that flies across Dickwella's body
back of a length on middle, and tapped off the back foot to the leg side. Safely negated
full on off, and he prods forward to carefully defend. Played towards the non-striker's direction
length ball on middle that stays slightly low. Dickwella takes a small step back, and fends it through to Chandimal at the other end
length ball on leg stump, and that's been clipped off his hips. Played over square leg, and the fielder at short leg goes chasing behind it - helmet and all. Stopped near the boundary
back of a length outside off. Chandimal keeps his eyes on the ball before fending it away to the off side
back of a length on off, and Chandimal tiptoes before blocking it towards the leg side
good length on off, and swaying away from Chandi after pitching. He sets up for the pull, but misses altogether. Dowrich has to dive to his right to stop the ball
length ball on middle, and flicked fine off his hips to the leg side. Quick outfield...
length ball on middle stump, and the ball soars over Chandimal's head. Too short, thinks the umpire
length ball on middle, and that's been turned around the corner on the leg side. Calls early for the single as the ball goes to square leg
full on middle, and Dickwella's done hanging around. Short-arm jabs it over midwicket, but the ball falls way inside the boundary. Roach goes to clean up
good length on off, and pushed off the back foot to cover point. They scamper across for one
gloved over the keeper! He'll take those. Short on leg, and Dickwella can't connect with the pull. Manages to glove it over Dowrich down the leg side, though
back of a length on leg, and that's been nudged into the gap in front of fine leg
back of a length on leg, and flicked off his hips to square leg. Well stopped by Bishoo there
back of a length outside off, and that's been punched with the bat's open face to cover point
good length on leg stump, and that's been blocked with soft hands to short square leg. Fended into the gap for a quick run
full outside off, and seaming away after pitching. Left alone by Chandimal
length ball on off, and that's been blocked away off the back foot. Soft hands
length ball on middle, and fended off the back foot again
back of a length outside off. Chandimal rides the bounce to defend towards cover point
full on off, and driven off the front foot. Hit well, and goes past Holder, but intercepted by mid off
length ball on off, and gets big on Dickwella straight away. Fended away
back of a length, but wide outside off. Dickwella's in no mood to play it
full on off, and blocked off the front foot. Played to the non-striker

edged to gully! Full and away from Dickwella's body. He tries to drive anyway, and the ball takes the shoulder of his bat. Flies to gully for a low-diving catch to his right. Terrific catch. Gabriel's on fayahhh
full outside off, and Dananjaya goes for the expansive drive. How did that not take the outside of his bat?!
overpitched on off, and Akila does well to squeeze this away towards cover. Almost a yorker
short on middle, and that's been swatted away by Chandimal. Swivels, rides the bounce, and then pulls it fine past the keeper's left
overpitched, wide outside off. Swinging further away, and Chandimal drags his cover drive to the on side
good length on middle, and fended off the back foot. Played carefully with soft hands
full on off, and angling into his pads. Chandimal does well to get his front leg out of the way and drive through to mid on
full outside off, and takes that boomerang bounce after pitching. Dananjaya drives tentatively but the ball's way past his bat's edge by the time he brings it down
length ball on leg stump, and that's been well fended off the back foot

length ball o middle stump, and comes in sharply after pitching. Hits the batsman's pads as he falls over the leg-side whip. The ball goes straight to Shai Hope at gully and Gabriel appeals for the catch. Replays say no bat's involved

full outside off, and angling in very sharply. The cover drive comes off the bat's inside half, and it trickles away to midwicket. Holder gives it a chase but can't stop them from coming back for a second
length ball on middle, and gets big on Chandimal. Still possesses the skills to whip it off his hips to deep midwicket
full, but wide outside off. No shot offered from Chandimal as the ball soars into Dowrich's gloves
full outside off, and driven off the front foot. Intercepted by cover
back of a length on middle, but going way down leg. Chandimal runs across to the off side so that the ball can safely go to Dowrich
length ball outside off, and Dananjaya pushes forward to drive. Firmly struck to cover
length ball outside off, and the ball almost takes a feather-touch off Dananjaya's outside edge. The ball sways slightly away and goes past Dananjaya's bat. So close to taking the edge
full outside off, and he check-drives through cover point. Played away from his body, but manages to find the gap between point and cover point. Comes back for the second
length ball, but way too wide outside off. He's happy to let it go
length ball outside off, but Dananjaya hangs his bat outside off. Pulls his bat back just in time before the ball whizzes past the outside of his bat

length ball outside off, and Dananjaya goes fishing again! This time he pays the price, as the ball takes the outside edge and falls to Dowrich's left. A diving effort from the keeper sends the lower-order batsman packing
length ball on off, and angling into Chandi. Flicked to midwicket
width offered outside off, and Lakmal isn't here to hang around. Slaps this, and the cut takes the bottom-edge of his bat and finds the gap between third slip and gully
full on leg stump, and Lakmal tries to flick it fine down the leg side. But misses the connection off his bat
length ball on middle, and Lakmal manages to turn this off his pads to square leg. Short leg goes running behind it
full outside off, and pushed with soft hands into the gap near cover point. Gets to the other end
back of a length on off, and Lakmal covers his off-stump before fending it away from his body. Sees the over out
short, and wide outside off. Chandimal cuts it away to deep point
full outside off, and driven to cover. Stopped by Chase inside the circle
back of a length outside off, and Chandimal is surprised by the bounce. Fended to point but it might've come off his gloves. Ouch!
back of a length, but wide outside off. He fetches it from way outside, but manages to cut it to the gap in front of point. Sri Lanka labour along to 200
length ball outside off, and it straightens after pitching. Left alone by Chandimal, but hey, it's a no ball. Overstepped by a bit
good length outside off, and punched off the back foot to cover point
good length outside off, and that's been punched to mid off to see the over. Lakmal to take strike next over
full on off and Lakmal gets onto the back foot this time. Blocked back to the bowler

wild, wild shot! Length ball outside off, and Lakmal tries to hook/pull over midwicket. Too full for that shot, and therefore takes the outside edge of his bat. Flies over Dowrich's outstretched hands...

stays low! Length ball outside off, and angling into Lakmal. The ball, however, doesn't bounce as much, and Lakmal misses the attempted forward punch. The ball goes under his bat, and through to Dowrich

up goes the finger! Lakmal wonders if he should review. Yeah he's reviewing. It was full on middle stump, and too quick for the lower-order batsman. He misses his leg-side flick and the ball hits his front leg. Tentative review from Lakmal, and the replays say he's gone. Pitched on off, and hits him in front of middle and leg. What does ball-tracking say? It says dead center. Crashing into leg stump. Sri Lanka lose a review and Gabriel takes a five-for!
full on leg stump, and going way down leg
length ball on middle, and Rajitha defends well off the back foot. Sends the shot back to Gabriel
length ball outside off, and that's been swatted off the back foot to deep point. Gets Rajitha on strike though
full outside off, and angling in after pitching. Rajitha misses the front-foot defense, and the ball goes past the outside of his bat. Goes to the keeper on the bounce
full just outside off, and pushed away from his body to mid off. Soft hands ensure the ball stays on the ground
good length on middle, and aimed at the batsman's body. He does well to nudge it off his hips to square leg. Gets off strike, more importantly
full on off, and driven on the up. Straight to mid on though
good length on middle, and that's been pulled away with disdain! Aimed at his head, but Chandimal spotted the length early and sent this away to the midwicket boundary
almost chopped on! Length ball outside off, and he tries to slap it past point. The ball comes slightly in, and takes the inside edge
length ball outside off, and the ball almost takes the outside of his bat as he looks to punch it to cover
full on off, and Rajitha does very well to defend off the front foot. Hits it back to Gabriel
back of a length, but very wide outside off. Left alone by the tailender
back of a length on middle and aimed right at his body. Rajitha can't get out of the ball's way and the delivery hits his front hand. Ouch! The batsman doesn't react to the blow though. Brave
back of a length outside off, and there's no reason for the batsman to play at it. Left alone, and that's drinks
good length outside off, and spinning further away. Cuts off the back foot, and played rather uppishly. Lands in front of point though
full just outside off, and he comes skipping down the wicket. Driven back to Bishoo
full outside off, and driven to cover off the front foot. Still no run
full on off stump, and driven down the ground to mid on. They walk across for one
full just outside off, and Rajitha takes a big stride forward. Defended
length ball on off, but the ball stays super low! Does well to keep his eyes on the ball, and tap it towards the off side
good length on middle, and going down leg. He ducks on this occasion
short and wide, and Chandimal is not afraid to free his arms. Cuts it past point, but not hit well enough. Doesn't even go to the boundary
good length on middle, and flicked off his hips to square leg. They walk across for one
back of a length outside off, and way too wide for Rajitha to even bother playing at it. Left alone
full on middle, and Rajitha attempts the fine flick down the leg side. Big appeal for lbw from Cummins, but that's been turned down. Replays say it hit his front leg, but impact was outside leg
length ball outside off, and Rajitha tries to drive away from his body. Through his shot way too late
reverse swept! Full outside off, and this is a proper pre-meditated shot. Swivels, changes his grip, and then swats it between first slip and backward point. Moves to the nineties.

appeal for lbw! But not given. Went for the reverse sweep again, but the ball's fuller on off. Impact may just been outside off though, but Bishoo wants to review. It did pitch in front of off stump, but the ball spun away from the wickets, and impact was outside off. That should save Chandimal. And yes, impact outside off. He'll stay alive. West Indies lose a review
full, and outside off. Chandimal steps towards the pitch of the ball, and drives to the sweeper fielder
length ball on off, and it's the googly! Comes sharply inwards and almost traps him in front of the stumps. Manages to get bat to ball though
full on off, and his big stride meets the ball on the full. Driven back to Bishoo
length ball on off, and the ball zoots through after pitching. Well defended off the back foot
good length on off, and takes off after hitting the deck. Extra bounce raps him on his glove
good length on middle, and he tiptoes to defend off the back foot
good length on middle, and flicked off his pads to the leg side
full on off, and pushed off the front foot to midwicket. Smothers this with the angle, but can't beat the fielder inside the circle
full outside off, and driven with the bat's open face. Manages to find the gap between cover and mid off, and that's a couple more to Chandimal's total. On 93 now

good length on middle, but angling into his pads. The leg-side flick is ricocheted onto his pads, and the ball goes to the off side. They're off for a quick run, and Cummins races forward to collect. Has a shy at the stumps, but the non-striker had already made it to the other side
flatter one on off, defended towards cover
lunges forward and defends this tossed up delivery
full and just around off, blunted
touch short, he goes back and whips this down to long-on
nice flight and loop on off, played back
defends with the bat well in front of the pad
thick outside edge towards square third man, was always going to be a risky second. Chandimal used the full dive to get back in even as a flat throw came in
full and moving away from off stump, steers this towards deep point but refuses the run
punched into the covers, has no choice but to take the single this time. Chandimal wasn't too keen for a run but by the time he decided it wasn't worth the risk, Rajitha had already crossed him!
goes from around the stumps and bowls too short down leg, he ducks under it
cops a blow on the glove as he fends, rolls towards the slips. Ouch

is that the end of Rajitha? Is there some glove as it lobbed to slip? Aleem Dar doesn't think so, Holder reviews. This short ball was angled across from around the stumps, got big on Rajitha as he looked to avoid that. Perilously close to the left glove, but the ball appears to have brushed the right shoulder. The ball misses the front glove, clipped the bottom glove but the hand was off the bat at that point, so that can't be given out
lunges forward and blocks the tossed up delivery
nice flight, lands this on off, eased past cover for a single
pushes one through, drifts in towards middle, Rajitha defends
lunges forward and defends back
driven into the gap at extra cover, comfortably back for the second
tossed up but this spins away from outside off, left alone
back of length outside off, left alone. Chandimal isn't too eager to get to the landmark

edged but this races away to the third man boundary. Chandimal brings up a superb, fighting century. His 11th in Tests, 2nd in West Indies and third as Sri Lanka captain. Can be a very proud man today.
bouncer angling away, he sways out of the way comfortably
hops back and across as he bunts this into the off side for a quick single
full outside off, eases this into the gap at cover
banged in short but this is way over his head, avoided easily.
jabs at a short of length delivery outside off, rolls off a thick inside edge towards the stumps but doesn't knock over the bails
play and a miss. This swung away late to beat the edge as he poked
floated full on middle from wide of the crease, defended back

edged and gone! Loose shot outside off, went for an expansive drive but was late on the stoke, only managed a thin edge through to Dowrich. Not the best shot to be playing when your captain is batting past his century at the other end.
full outside off, this one nips back in but not enough to get him playing.
full and wide, once again left alone
sees this short, there's no midwicket so he climbs into this. Slapped away to that region. He's going to play shots now
there in his zone again, goes hard to clear mid-off, but can't get it to the boundary. Two it will be
floats this full on off, defended back
turns this full ball on middle and leg towards mid-on
directs one full and straight on the stumps from around the wicket, kept out
angling in from around the stumps, but not enough to get him playing, through to the keeper
punches this length ball into the gap at extra cover, excellent running, aggressive running. Kumara being alert to the possibility was key there
walloped up and over long-off. Nowhere near being a full ball but he'd decided to throw the kitchen sink at the ball.
sways out of the way of this short ball angling in
hops back and across and defends

that's the end of that, or is it? Chandimal last man out, but what an innings this has been. Looks to work this through midwicket, only to get a leading edge that has been held at point. But, hey. Oh, wait. Roach has overstepped, so Chandimal survives. What drama!
goes back and across to squirt this length ball to point

taken this time! Full ball that swerves away late, he went for a drive, found a thick edge that has been snaffled nicely at gully. They checked for a no-ball again, no drama this time as his front foot is well behind the line.
angles in a short of length delivery into the rib cage, nicely tucked away wide of square leg for a couple
slips a short of length delivery down leg, avoided
gets this to bounce off an awkward length outside off, left alone
touch fuller and just outside off, left alone again. Great leave too
back of length delivery nipping away from outside off, watched through to the keeper
there for the drive, Brathwaite is happy to leave
draws him forward, he looks to drive but gets a thick inside edge towards mid-on
flatter one on off, he goes back into the crease and defends
zips back in from length to thud into the pad
right into the blockhole, squeezed back
goes right back into the crease and blunts this
right to the pitch of the ball as he smothers it. That's stumps on day one in St Lucia
accurate start. Full on middle, and has Brathwaite shuffling across to the off side and defending towards his non-striker
length ball, but wide outside off. Brathwaite goes fishing - sticking his bat out - and tapping it to cover point
length ball, but on middle. Going down the leg sdie, and Brathwaite misses the leg-side flick. Trickles down to fine leg
full on off, and shaping away from him slightly. Forces Smith to prod forward and push towards Brathwaite
length ball on leg, and shaping down the leg side. He misses out on the nudge at square leg. Hits his thigh
once again drifting onto the leg stump, clipped to square leg
length ball on middle, and targeting Brathwaite's body. Uncomfortably nudged to midwicket off the back foot
ooo, just past his outside edge. Full on off but angling into him. Brathwaite defends inside the delivery's line, and the ball whizzes through to Dickwella
length ball outside off, and met by Brathwaite outside off stump. Walks to his right and then blocks it away
short and wide outside off. Brathwaite carefully sees the ball through to the keeper's gloves
full, but going down leg. Dickwella does well to rush to his left and intercept
back of a length outside off, and once again left alone by the batsman. A maiden to start his Test career
length ball on middle, but drifting down leg. Whipped off his hips to square leg, which has the short-leg fielder running towards
full just outside off, and forces the batsman to play at it with the angle coming in. Defended back to the bowler
length ball outside off, but swinging in sharply. Fended off the back foot from in front of off stump
length ball outside off, and shaping further away. Left alone by Brathwaite on this occasion
full outside off, and takes a boomerang bounce after pitching. Soars into Dickwella's gloves. Takes it from in front of his face
full outside off, and shaping away from the batsman. Too wide for him to play at it
length ball on off, and going across Smith's body. Lets it go through to the keeper
full, and wide outside off. Going across Smith's body and lets it go through to the keeper
length ball on off, and Smith lets the ball go through to Dickwella. No real deviation off the surface for now. A predicable bounce and movement from Rajitha to the left-handed batsman
full outside off, and driven square off the front foot. Stopped by cover point. Just a bit full, and therefore drawing him to drive. Meets the ball late
length ball on off, and jagging further away from the left-hander. Came off a crack, I think. Through to Dickwella
full on leg stump, and clipped off his boots to fine leg. Enough time to take a single
length ball on off, and he rides the bounce to defend it towards short mid off
full on off, and Smith shuffles to cover his off stump, before shouldering his arms to the bowler
full outside off, and swinging into Smith. He prods slightly forward and defend it to the bowler
full outside off, and going through to the keeper. Shoulders his arms
full on middle, but swinging down leg. Well, almost, as Smith tries to whip it to fine leg, but falls over due to a lack of balance. Hits his back leg, but impact's outside leg
good length on off, and hits Smith's front leg as he tries to flick to the leg side. He misses the shot, and the ball hits the top of off stump
full outside off, and swinging further away from the left hander. Shoulders his arms
full on off, and going across his body. Smith comes forward and tentatively pushes to cover
length ball on leg, and that's been nudged off his hips fine down the leg side. Chase for fine leg, and he manages to cut it off before the ball trickles away to the boundary
length ball on middle, and tapped off his legs to the fielder at square leg. Enough time to scamper across for one
good length on off, and angling into Brathwaite. He drops his hands on this delivery, and just taps it off the back foot to midwicket. Soft hands
full on middle stump, and whipped off his toes to midwicket. Once again falling over while playing that shot - needs to work on his post-shot balance
full, but outside off. Left alone by Smith
length ball outside off, and Brathwaite covers his off stump before letting the ball go through to Dickwella
full just outside off, and he check-drives straight down the ground. Lakmal dives to his right but can't stop the ball. Mid off and mid on give it a chase
back of a length on middle, and forces the batsman to duck
length ball on off, and zipping inwards this time. Watchful from the batsman, as he skips to the off side and then turns it off his hips to square leg
full on off, and defended off the front foot
length ball on off, and angling into the left-hander. Tapped off his pads to square leg
full outside off, and swinging away from the batsman. Brathwaite gets his front leg forward, and then leaves it alone
full outside off, and driven firmly down the ground. Struck well, but goes straight to the fielder at mid off
full outside off, and once again finding some shape as the ball sways away from Brathwaite. He covers his off stump and then shoulders his arms
length ball outside off, and shaping away from Brathwaite. Left alone once again
stays low! First signs of the pitch showing some variable bounce. Full, but wide outside off. Hits the rough and skids through to Dickwella on the bounce
full outside off, and Brathwaite tentatively comes forward to try and drive it square. Pulls out of the shot at the last moment with the ball swinging away
length ball on off, and he goes onto the back foot to tap it towards cover point
length ball outside off, and goes just past the batsman's outside edge. Extra bounce after pitching as Brathwaite defends inside the line of the delivery. Keeps the slip cordon interested
full outside off, and jags inwards after pitching. Brathwaite had covered his offstump, and then shoulders his arms
back of a length outside off, and Brathwaite pulls his bat back over his shoulders. Indication that he was in two minds to play a cut shot
length ball on off, and comes in sharply! Brathwaite tries to defend off the front foot, but the ball shapes oh-so-slightly away after jagging in, and surprises the batsman completely
length ball outside off, and another snorter to end the over. Takes some extra bounce as it goes past the outside of his bat's shoulder

huuge appeal for lbw! But he'll have to wait for his maiden Test wicket. Full outside off, but swinging in sharply from around the wicket. Hits his front leg in front of middle stump, but the umpire thinks it would've gone down leg
once again around the wicket, and oh boy, he's getting some late tail inwards. Full on middle, and uncomfortably flicked off the front foot to deep backward square leg
banana swing! That shall remind you of Roberto Carlos' freekicks. The ball starts off outside off, but swings in to finish up on middle stump. Mistimed back to the bowler
good length on off, and tailing in once again. Slightly shorter, the length, so he manages to nudge it towards midwicket
full outside off, and swinging in sharply. Smith, however, is up to the challenge and drives this straight down the ground to long on. Hit well, but Lakmal still manages to cut it off from mid off
full on off, and tapped to the leg side off his toes

Big appeal for lbw, but Dar isn't convinced. Sri Lanka are reviewing. It was a length ball outside off, but it stayed low and angled in as well. Hits his front pad on top of the knee roll, but that variable bounce should make things interesting. What does ball-tracking say? It says: impact in front of off, and just clipping middle stump. Umpire's call, and therefore Brathwaite survives. Sri Lanka retain the review.
back of a length outside off, and keeping the batsman on his toes. Rides the bounce and fends to short cover
full on off and angling into his pads. Brathwaite does well to cover his offstump, and then taps it to midwicket. 145kph reads the speedgun
length ball on off, but Brathwaite shuffles across, flicks off his hips, and glances this to fine leg for a walking single
full on off and angling across Smith. He prods forward - to cover his off stump - and then shoulders his arms. Nice carry through to the keeper
full on off, and whizzes past the outside edge of Brathwaite's bat. Attempts to drive but beaten by pace
length ball outside off, and shaping away from the batsman. Left alone by Brathwaite
full on leg stump, and going down leg. Lakmal slowed things up (125kph), and this bounces through to Dickwella
full on off, and driven down the ground. Comes off the bat's outside half, though, and therefore squirts away to cover point
length ball on off, so close to the outside of his bat! Just about goes over the top of off stump
length ball on middle, and flicked off his pads to deep backward square leg
full on off, and shapes inwards after pitching. Blocked off the back foot to Lakmal
length ball on leg, and going down the leg side. Dickwella can't stop it with his diving effort and that's the first boundary of the over! Byes though
length ball outside off, and going to Dickwella from near his face. Left alone
length ball on middle, and ends up in Dickwella's gloves down the leg side. Uncontrolled swing so far

bounce! Full outside off, and takes a crazy bounce after pitching. Takes off - dust and all - after pitching and Dickwella has to jump to try and stop the ball. The batsman attempted to defend for the incoming ball, but the delivery held its line
back of a length outside off. Brathwaite tiptoes and taps it to cover point

full on off, and with some late tail added to the delivery. Flicked off his toes to wide long on, and they call late for the three. Could be close but Brathwaite manages to finish the third before the bowler can whip the bails off
slides into the pads - in the attempt to keep the ball at the stumps - and Brathwaite picks him off to deep square leg
full and tantalisingly wide outside off. Smith is hungry for runs but not quite that hungry
shifts around the wicket and sends down a short delivery outside off. Smith ushers it through to the keeper like a gentleman
tucks this back of a length delivery off his hip to square leg

draws him into playing with half a bat, but Lakmal doesn't quite have the same pace as Kumara and so Smith has that extra millisecond to correct his mistake. Softens the grip on his bat and blocks the short one towards point
snarls in off the pitch, but Smith plays a charming little nudge to fine leg.

full and straight and it has the left-hander falling over. That late movement Kumara is getting is keeping Smith on the back foot, keeping him unsure about whether to come forward or back. The last-minute flick is absolutely useless
digs it in, hoping for the rib-cage, but the variable bounce on this pitch only allows it to get up to the stomach. Smith pulls it to fine leg
another one, speared in full and at the stumps. Smith tries to turn it to square leg but gets struck on the pad and weathers the lbw appeal
there's the first boundary of the innings! Clearly, the 100th ball is the charm! Comes out a full toss outside off and Brathwaite steers it behind point
steep bounce as he hits the deck outside off. But that line isn't going to make Brathwaite play.

that's better. He hits the pitch - and this one is being extremely friendly with him - and targets off stump. Brathwaite knows he needs to protect it and does so, squaring himself up and getting a bit of an outside edge
tosses it up from around the wicket, Smith lunges forward, trying to get to the pitch of it and blocks
heeeeyyy, you can't do that! This innings has been going along like a walk in the park but suddenly Smith leaps out from the hedges and scares the bowler silly with a heave over midwicket.
all the way!! What is going on?!? Who flicked the T20 switch while I was asleep? Smith charges out again, much like he did the last ball, and smears a length ball over long-on. Stupendous
nudges it off the back foot through midwicket
tosses it up on middle, Smith is forward with a straight bat

the ball slides down leg and Smith is all set to flick it away. Then he decides he needs to be a bit more brutal. Attempts a pull shot. But to no avail. Have to be more decisive, mate. Like you were earlier in the over.
good length on off stump, keeps it out
shuffles in line with a fuller delivery on middle and off and turns it towards square leg

bottom edge! And a panic-stricken Brathwaite turns back to survey his stumps, expecting wreckage, but the ball has taken a detour to the keeper. Another lucky escape for the opener. These short-of-a-length but not outright bouncers from Kumara, on and around off stump, are a real sight today. Brathwaite is set up to block, then wonders if he should leave, finally he plays a nothing shot and survives
bouncer outside off, sways away
gets in line with a back of a length ball on and around off stump
yorker on off stump, Brathwaite's defences are #Swag-like
loops it up on off stump, from around the wicket. Smith thinks of lofting it again - the backlift goes nice and high. But the ball dips lovely and low, making him defend instead
goes back to a shortish delivery outside off and slides it to point
he's getting the offbreaks to dip nicely and as a result he is not letting Smith get to the pitch to smother the spin. A little extra bounce. And a knock on the splice of the bat
knocks it down to long-on
squares him up with Brathwaite expecting the ball to turn in from outside off, but it just goes straight on
hangs back to a good length ball on off stump, reading it off the pitch and nudging it towards short leg

inside edge and the ball evades the stumps again. Oy, who stole Sri Lanka's luck?! Smith fell in this fashion in the last Test, lured by a full and wide delivery. He only just survives here against a similar delivery

beaut! This pitch with its patchwork quilt grass pattern is making some kick up and some keep low. This one hits back of a length and surges at Brathwaite's chest. He tries to block it, but ends up being beaten
goes full on off stump, and that hint of away seam secures the outside edge. Good on Brathwaite to play with soft hands

sooo close to off stump! The ball was practically whispering in its ear... 'I'll come for you later. Just wait.' Lovely stuff. Goes wide of the crease, and with that slingly arm action too. Hits a good length outside off, has the batsman leaving, and then sighing in relief
good length on off stump, defends

picks the legbreak and smears it through the covers. Oh, this is top-class batting from Brathwaite. Strong stride forward - so much that he was outside the crease when he makes contact. And then the full face of the bat wrapping up the image
good length offbreak, he goes back to block
quicker through the air, flatter in trajectory, straight at the stumps, Brathwaite is untroubled
veering to leg stump, Brathwaite turns it to short leg
looks for a single through mid-on, but Dananjaya dives across to his right, braving a collision with the non-striker, and grabs the ball
shifts back to nudge a shorter delivery on leg stump to short leg
forces him back with a short ball but Smith knocks it down easily enough
defends a shortish delivery on off stump. Rajitha, by the way, is continuing around the wicket with three slips
full, juicy and tempting outside off. Smith licks his lips but the voice in his head says 'it's not time yet.' So he leaves
on the pads - the reward for his patience - and Smith accepts gratefully with a single behind square leg
digs it into the middle of the pitch, but Brathwaite handles it well enough, getting up off his toes and blocking on top of the bounce
back of a length on off stump, blunts it again
looks ever so good on the forward defence. Head nice and low over the ball, front foot making way towards the pitch..
shifts back against a shorter delivery on the stumps and blocks it
strides forward and judges the line of this one to be outside off. So no need to play
goes back to block a good length offbreak. Dananjaya is bowling slow. The pitch is taking pace off. Smith has all the time he needs
another one that he plays from the safety of the crease, even though this time Dananjaya ramps his pace up
presses forward to block a tossed up delivery outside off.
squares him up with late movement away off the pitch. Brathwaite, however, by playing late and with soft hands makes sure the edge goes down
good length, outside off, Brathwaite ignores it like a text from an ex.

leading edge! But it doesn't carry to the man at gully! Looks like the extra protection on the on side is a good idea. It's helping Rajitha bowl straight and the late movement is putting Brathwaite is big trouble. He's closed off, trying to flick through midwicket, and it's credit to the bowler for him making that mistake. The angle into the right-hander, the late movement, just lovely...

given caught behind but Brathwaite reviews immediately! Regardless of the decision - made by Aleem Dar - this is such a good cherry. Nice and full. Movement off the pitch. The batsman is caught in the crease, poking in front of his body, and Ultra-Edge confirms he has edged it. Special occasion for Rajitha - it's his maiden wicket in Test cricket. And what a ball it is too.

flicks it through midwicket - late swing, who cares?! He gets a ball that starts off angling towards the slips, then it curls in off the pitch. Powell though is good enough to take it on. Key to that is not plonking his front foot too far across
good length ball on off stump, defends
now we have turn! Proper big turn, snarling past the outside edge. The length is short though, which is why Smith survives
lbw appeal! The wily Dananjaya pushes through the straight one, into the pads, right after the big offbreak. An inside edge saves Smith
presses forward to block a fuller delivery on middle and leg
quicker but still full enough that Smith has to come forward and block
slower through the air and drawing Smith outside his off stump. Defence again
full on off stump, keeps it out.
nudges a length ball off his pads through square leg
shifts back to present the full face of the bat to a short delivery on off stump
full and outside off, draws Smith into a drive and beats him
targets the stumps, but with that slingy action and his going around the wicket, Smith has an easy put away through midwicket
defends a good length ball in line with off stump
looks to drive on the up but ends up inside edging a fuller delivery outside off through mid-on. And on that note, we head off for lunch
back of a length and outside off, from around the wicket, of course. Smith lets it sashay past
shortish and a good distance outside off. Smith stands and waves buh-bye
hides the ball outside the off stump and Smith is all too happy to play this game. Or more accurately not play (a shot).
ventures a little closer to off stump and Smith punches the short ball to cover
short and wide. Smith shoulders arms and walks away to square leg. Deep breaths now.
pitches it up, searching for the drive, and the outside edge but Smith remains boring. Excellently boring.
skews away to the third man boundary! Powell sees the opportunity to get on the front foot and drive on the up and he is not the kind to let it pass. Thick outside edge for much profit

direct hit would have had him!! Powell wants to pinch a single, knocking the ball in front of point. It's fraught with risk and if Dananjaya had nailed the target at the non-strikers' - he was only inches away - West Indies would have lost another wicket
goes for the bouncer, the line goes down leg and Smith, the more composed left-hander, lets it go
blunts a back of a length delivery on leg stump
covers the stumps and defends the good length ball on off stump to point
bangs it into the deck, hoping to seem menacing, but Smith is not impressed. Rocks back and pulls it dismissively through midwicket
full and only a shade outside off. But Smith's judgment of line today has been spot on. He knows he doesn't need to play
short and way too wide to draw Smith into a shot
good length angling into the left-hander, but not quite enough to threaten the stumps. Smith plants his front foot and then hoists the bat skyward. Good stuff.
another leave as Lakmal keeps pitching it up but continues to be shy about approaching the stumps. Aw.
either Lakmal is seeing a hologram of Smith batting five feet to the left of where he is, or bowling wide of off stump is part of the plan
nips in off the pitch, does this good length ball, and Smith leaves once again. Although this is a much tighter leave as the ball whooshes over off stump
defends a fullish delivery on middle and leg stump

lashes it over the boundary behind point! Sensational strike - even more so because at first it almost seemed like he was about to leave this rank short and wide delivery. Eventually he realises he has runs for the taking and upper cuts beautifully
back of a length on middle, keeps it out
flirts with this short delivery angling across him and almost nicks it through to the keeper

another run-out chance! Phew! What is with Powell and quick singles today?! He thumps the ball to mid-off, looking nothing short of a boss. But then he decides he wants runs for a shot as good as that and sets off. Puts in a full-length dive to try and beat Chandimal's throw and lives to tell the tale only because it isn't a direct hit
full and on off stump, Smith drives through cover
shortish on middle and leg, turns it around through midwicket

sharp inward movement. Perhaps this's why Lakmal was bowling wide outside off..He wants Smith to leave on evidence of the initial line - as he does here - and then hope that the angle from around the wicket and the additional seam movement brings the stumps into play
pitches it up outside off, Smith lunges forward and across - covering his stumps - and then leaves
smashes the short ball through point. The outfield though isn't quite the most considerate.
spears it through the gap between point and gully. Excellent shot to a pretty rank half-volley.
full on off stump, drills it to mid-off
pulls the short ball to the left of midwicket. But Rajitha does well not to give away a single.
back of a length and outside off, no shot

beats him with a fuller delivery at 143 kph. The width on the ball draws Smith into a shot. He see's a scoring opportunity but the movement off the pitch - which happens heinously late - foils his plans

just short of gully! Smith is prepared for a short ball, but this one seems to be cramping him for room, and also bouncing a little higher than he wants it. Does his best to chop down on top of it and only just survives
outside off and so he lets it go

nicks past second slip! Well, he certainly has earned his luck today, even if it was these very deliveries that he was leaving not so long ago. Good length, on and around off stump. Forces his hands at the ball and benefits, even if he didn't quite plan it all perfectly
goes back to a length ball sliding on with the arm from around the wicket and works it to wide mid-on
slices a shortish delivery outside off to cover point
good length and outside off, Powell ignores it
stands up tall and punches a shortish delivery down to long-on
good length outside off, no shot
searches for the blockhole from around the wicket, and finds it too. But the batsman brings down a straight bat and negates its threat
bouncer now, a shade outside off, Powell ducks under it
back of a length on off stump, defends
presses forward to a fuller delivery on off stump and blocks towards mid-off
leans into a drive and has enough power on the shot to make the boundary at cover. Width on the ball brings out an aggressive shot from Smith

peach! An absolute peach. Especially from around the wicket. It pitches in line with off stump, demanding the batsman to play, and then straightens off the angle, snarling past the outside edge. Even a set batsman has no chance
shimmies down the pitch to defend a tossed up delivery on off stump
defends a full delivery on and around off stump
reads a shortish delivery, goes back and blocks it
short again, allowing Powell to stay in the safety of his crease and block
drives sweetly down the ground to long-on
appeal for lbw but it's likely the ball has come off the inside edge first. Quicker delivery, flatter trajectory, somehow hurries off the pitch and catches Smith in the middle of his defensive push
another appeal for lbw, but this one is probably high. Kumara using the angle from around the wicket to target the stumps. A little movement in off the pitch helps beat the inside edge
bangs it in short and slants it well down the leg side. Smith is happy not to do any work on this ball
pulls the short ball to deep square leg and raises his first Test fifty since comeback. Very gritty innings.

beats the edge with a rip-snorter. So says the umpire at least, but Chandimal wants to review for caught behind. What a ball though. A Kumara special. Back of a length. Straightening off the angle from around the wicket. Surprising Powell. But luckily for him, he isn't anywhere close to the ball. Pretty poor review from Sri Lanka.
sharp bouncer, looking for the throat of the left-hander. Powell does well too, not shying away, yanking the bottom hand off the straight bat. The perfect way to deal with a spitting cobra
beats the edge again with a slightly fuller delivery. This angle from around the wicket is making the left-handers feel for balls they may not need to.
full and on off stump, he lunges forward to block
pushes it through on middle and leg, Smith has to hurry into his defensive push
shortish and outside off, he cuts to point
goes back and flicks a flatter delivery off to backward square leg
nudges a length ball off his pads towards short fine leg. Powell wants a single, but he's sent back
shifts back and blocks a good length delivery down the pitch
bouncer, no need to bother with that, says Smith
full on off, and driven on the up. Struck firmly, but straight to mid on
length ball outside off, but taking a lot of bounce after hitting the deck. Goes through to the keeper as Powell shoulders his arms

back of a length on off, and gets big on Powell! He tries to defend off the back foot, but the ball hits his bat's shoulder and falls just short of second slip. Comes off the bat's handle, indicates the instant replay
full outside off, and that's been caressed through the covers. Half-volley in Powell's slot, and he's quick to shuffle onto the front foot. Fifty partnership
length ball outside off, and going through to Dickwella. Left alone by the batsman
length ball on middle, and that's been clipped off his hips to fine leg. Gets across to the other end
full, but wide outside off. Dickwella has to run to first slip to try and stop the ball. Does well, though
back of a length on off, and going further away from him. Shoulders his arms
back of a length on middle, in a bid to cramp the batsman. Does well, but Powell is up to the challenge. Tiptoes and works it to midwicket
length ball on off,and angling across his body. Left alone by Smith
back of a length outside off, and the ball's angling in slightly. Forces Smith to play at it, and he fends it to cover off the back foot
