full outside off, and drilled through cover. Hit well, but the surface has been slowed down after the spell of rain. Chandimal races after it, and manages to cut it off from inside the boundary
length ball, but outside off stump. Powell steps forward to drive through cover, but the ball angles in and hits the inside-half of his bat. The ball trickles away to mid on
back of a length on off, and angling into the batsman's body. Tapped back to the non-striker

soft appeal for caught behind, but the bowler was never interested. Went short on middle, and sends the batsman swaying away from the ball's line. Tries to leave by dropping his hands, but the ball was perilously close to his glove
short outside leg, and this time it really does take off after pitching. Goes down the leg side, but Dickwella has to jump really high to intercept the ball
attempted yorker on off, but ends up as a low full toss. Driven to the on-side, but mistimed to midwicket
length ball on leg stump, and clipped away to square leg. Man there

the extra ball fetches him a wicket! Pretty rare. Full on off, and forces the batsman to drive. Takes the bat's outside edge, and goes in front of second slip. Mendis has to dive forward to complete the catch. The ball was always dropping on the fielder
back of a length outside off, but tailing in like crazy after hitting the deck. He shoulders his arms but the ball goes over the top of off stump. Keeps Rajitha interested
length ball outside off, and goes through to the keeper as Smith shoulders his arms once again
back of a length outside off. Angling into the batsman, and he punches off the back foot to cover
back of a length, but very wide outside off. No angle inwards either, and the delivery goes straight into Dickwella's gloves
full outside off, but shaping into Smith. He comes forward and drives towards cover. Comes off the bat's outside edge, and the delivery flies to point instead
full, and wide outside off. Comes tailing in though, but Smith covers his off stump and lets the ball go
back of a length outside off, and really does take off after hitting the deck. Goes under the batsman's armpits, and through to the keeper
back of a length outside off, and gets big on Hope again. He tries to defend off the back foot - and from near his face - & manages to push it towards Dananjaya at point
back of a length outside off, and whizzes past the outside of his bat. Could've easily taken the bat's outside edge. Hope tried to defend, but played the shot inside the delivery's line
full toss on off, and Hope punches it straight back to the bowler. Searching for the yorker, but slipping out of his hands

back of a length outside off, and takes off after hitting the pitch! Hope shoulders his arms, and Dickwella collects this ball from in front of his chest. Probing line, and asking questions to the batsman every single time
back of a length outside off, and Hope tiptoes in an attempt to defend. He's way inside the line of the ball though. Through to Dickwella, and that's a maiden
full outside off, and going through to the keeper. No shot offered from the batsman
length ball outside off, and once again carries through to the keeper. Smith's happy to let it go
length ball on middle, but going down leg. Smith, however, manages to nudge it behind square with the angle, and walks across for one. Fine leg cleans up in the deep

length ball outside off, and holds its line after pitching. On that annoying fourth-stump channel, and Hope attempts to defend. Keeps his bat hanging outside off, but the ball goes past it and through to the keeper
back of a length on the fourth-stump line, and almost takes the outside edge of Hope's bat. He defends inside the line of the ball again
overpitched outside off, and Hope comes forward for the cover drive. Mistimed, though, and that's why he'll only get two
length ball outside off, and jags away after pitching. Smith wanted to cut it square, but misses the shot. A false stroke from the set batsman
short outside off, but he was prepared for the length. Gets quickly into position for the pull, but hits this straight to midwicket
length ball outside off, and this time he leaves it alone. The umpires have a chat again. And it's stumps. Bad light.
bouncer first up! Hurries him with pace and gets it to climb pretty steeply as well. Smith scampers under it

another short ball, Smith gets under it. Dickwella jumps and does well to gather it. Smith walks out for some gardening and Dickwella flings it towards the stumps and then appeals. Gould has a chat with him and rules the ball to have been dead by the time Smith strode out
make that a third consecutive short ball. Too much bounce, and called a no-ball
back of a length, angled in at leg, Smith jumps back and keeps it out on the leg side
fullish on the pads, flicked to midwicket
short of a length outside off, Smith shuffles across and blocks
back of a length, curves in from wide outside off and Smith shoulders arms
back of a length, keeps a little low, and Dickwella fails to gather it as a result after Smith lets it go
good length outside off, Smith shuffles across and defends
back of a length, curving in from outside off, left alone
full on the pads, clipped to midwicket
full outside off, leans into a drive through covers
good length, cuts in towards off, Hope is solid in defence into the off side
short of a length, jumps back and blocks
short of a length, angled in from wide of the crease and shooting past the batsman as he keeps his bat inside
good length, moves in sharply from outside off, blocked
flighted on middle, blocked down the pitch
slides it down the leg side and gets past Smith's attempted tuck
flighted length ball, blocked to the off side
again slides it towards leg and he tucks to short fine leg
floated up on middle and leg, driven off the inside of the bat towards mid-on
just back of a length, shuffles across and tucks to short fine leg
short outside off, not bothered with
short of a length and curving in late, left alone
full outside off, driven powerfully to short cover where the fielder dives and half-stops it. Good effort
shortish, jumps back and blocks
shortish, angled in from outside off, Hope jumps and gets hit on the chest. That's a weakness in Hope to exploit
short of a length, jumps and tucks behind square
spins in and he tucks to midwicket
comes on with the arm and heads down leg
straightening on leg, tucked behind square
comes forward to defend and gets an inside edge to the on side
full and sliding on leg, blocked
flighted on middle, drops it to mid-off and takes off for a quick single
fullish on the pads, worked behind square
shortish outside off, jumps and blocks to gully
dipping yorker on middle, dug out and takes him off his feet. 147ks!
short and angled in, jumps and blocks
short, angled in and he gets under it
good length, blocked in front of off
full on the stumps, blocked
full and curved into leg, drilled down the ground
full outside off, blocked
pitched up outside off, driven square of the wicket, Kumara with a brilliant save as he gives it a hot chase and dives to try and pull it back. But the ball has just about enough to beat him
bounces off a length, Hope flicks it through leg gully
tossed up on leg, drilled to midwicket diving to his right
good length on off, blocked into the off side
full on the pads, flicked to deep backward square leg
full outside off, driven pristinely through the covers
shortish outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, gets on top and blocks
short of a length, shifts back and it keeps a little low as he keeps his bat inside
full on the stumps, clipped into the leg side
flighted on middle and leg, driven to long-on
length on middle, gets sightly opened up as it keeps straight as he defends
advances down the ground and drives to long-on
shuffles across to a length ball and blocks
full on leg, clipped through midwicket
shuffles across to a back of a length delivery and blocks
back of a length, keeps awfully low as he lets it go outside off

brilliant bowling. Maybe the variable bounce had the batsman off guard but it's well done anyway. After the last one kept low, Lakmal bangs this one in and gets it to jag away just enough to open him up and poke at it to get an edge to first slip
short of a length outside off, blocked
back of a length, jags away discernibly, left alone
short and ducked under
tossed up outside off, driven to short cover
flighted and no turn outside off, keeps low and left alone
back of a length, stays back and turns it away to midwicket
sprayed down the leg side
spins in from a length and hits the front pad
and again, clips the pad as it drifts in. Heading down leg

short of a length, angled across, Smith tries to whip across the line and gets hit on the pad. Appeal turned down and Chandimal refers this upstairs. Could have pitched outside leg. Hits the high part of the back pad, so height may be a factor here too. No bat. Waiting for ball-tracking. Pitching well outside off. Review lost
short of a length, blocked in to the legside
short of a length, angled across, pulled away to midwicket
short of a length, angled in, tucked to the on side
looks to flick against the line and gets hit on the pad. Heading down with that angle

fullish length, strides across and opens the face to work it away past the cordon, through the third man region. Chandimal runs after it. KUsal Mendis run after it. Chandimal gets low and pulls the ball back. Mendis gets low and realises he, too, may get past the boundary, so he flicks it back. In the end, boundary saved
has to hurry into bringing his bat down as a length ball dips neatly on off stump.
no holds barred this time as Chase spots the flighted delivery and launches it over midwicket
lunges at a full delivery on middle and drives to mid-on
shifts himself leg side of a shortish delivery on off stump and slices it to cover
for half a second, Chase thinks he is to the pitch of this loopy delivery on leg stump. Then it dips on him and so he has to bring his wrists into play to keep it down
ends the over with a poor ball - short and wide and Chase smacks it through cover. Top shot. Doesn't overhit. Just concentrates on the basics of using the crease and exploiting the gap

beats him with a sumptuous delivery! Lakmal runs in from around the wicket, hits a good length and wills the ball to straighten off the angle. Smith - even though he has faced 169 deliveries - has no clue about it. Stays rooted to the crease and feels for it outside the off stump
fuller delivery outside off, no shot

past the bat again! And Lakmal gives him a stare, or is it meant for the universe for denying him the outside edge? In any case, this is top class bowling, and he's pitching it up too, drawing Smith into a nearly fatal drive.
back of a length on off stump, blocks
ooooh, nearly shaves off stump as Smith leaves and then prays for the inswing not to do him in. Great bowling from Lakmal, moving it both ways
goes full and into the pads, Smith tries to knock it down towards square leg. Settles for a leg bye

keeps low and traps him plumb in front of middle and off! This weakness - taking far too long to commit to the front foot - has been apparent all through his innings. And finally a Sri Lanka bowler pitches it up, drawing him forward. Smith believes this to be the offbreak and plays for the turn. But Dananjaya benefits from natural variation, with the ball drifting in, pitching outside off stump and then going on with the angle from around the wicket to strike low on the front pad. Umpire Gould wastes no time getting the finger up
tosses it up outside off, Dowrich strides forward to defend
the ball dips sharply outside off and forces Dowrich to be circumspect as he shuffles across and defends
that's sweetly hit behind point as he moves back and across to carve a shortish delivery to the man in the deep
manages to slant it behind point again, Chase this time
sneaks in the legbreak, which Dowrich handles well enough, even though it only bounces sharply instead of turning sharply. Neat little nudge down and past leg gully
hangs back against the shortish delivery and guides it to point
works the back of a length ball to midwicket
defends a fuller delivery on off stump
finds substantial inward movement off the pitch but Chase is able to drag his front foot - which plonks on off stump - back enough to bring the middle of the bat into play
short and wide outside off, Chase ignores it
looks for a few runs at third man, but even as he guides the short ball expertly, Roshen Silva at gully throws himself to his right and grabs the ball like it's his favourite piece of chocolate
loooooops it up outside off and Dowrich laces it to mid-off
continues to get lovely dip on the ball, bringing batsman forward, but rarely allowing them the half-volley to drive
works a full ball on off stump to mid-on
closes the face and gives it a whip of wrists, but the quicker ball on middle and leg finds midwicket
shortish and outside off, Dowrich punches to mid-on
turns a flighted delivery on middle to midwicket
shortish and outside off, no interest from Chase
lets the back of a length delivery come to him with the angle and then defuses it behind square leg
very late and very lazy in bringing the bat down to meet a good length ball outside off and the resulting inside edge goes through bat, pad and past leg stump
works a shortish delivery from outside off to mid-on
full and outside off, Dowrich senses the danger of flirting with such a delivery and leaps under his bed to hide
shifts inside the line of a short ball and whips it strongly to deep backward square leg
oooh, outside edge as Dananjaya gets glorious drift away from the right hander, pulling Dowrich to poke at the ball outside off.
pushes forward to block a fuller delivery outside off
sharp turn off the pitch and Chase deals with it by pulling his front foot back so that he has the room to force the bat down on the ball and keep it away from short leg

good shot - he waits for the tossed up delivery on middle and leg and launches it over midwicket. Dananjaya is a proper threat right now, getting the ball to drift away and turn in, so Chase is doing well to attack him
turns a fuller delivery out to midwicket
stands tall against the shortish delivery and whacks short leg in his effort to score runs
back of a length and outside off, Dowrich lets it pass
blocks a short of a length delivery outside off. But he isn't quite moving towards the line of the ball, and is therefore leaving a gap between bat and pad
short and wide, so easy decision to leave

huge appeal for lbw but Umpire Dar says no and walks away. Height could be the issue because otherwise the ball nips back in sharply to pin Dowrich in front of all three stumps. There's the weakness exploited - the one where Dowrich is hanging his bat without moving his feet and creating a gap between inside edge and pad
now he takes the ball away and a muddled Dowrich forgets where his off stump is and chases after it to be beaten
wide half-volley which Dowrich smashes through the covers, looking quite regal doing so. Lovely stride forward, knee almost touching the ground while the high elbow shows itself off
tosses it up on off stump, Dowrich forces it to mid-on
the front leg lunges outside off and then the bat has to hurry coming down in front of it as Dananjaya keeps bowling full, but this time increases his pace noticeably. Great skill
full on off stump, drives to mid-on
the moment the line drifts towards leg, Dowrich is down with the sweep, playing it well. Square leg moves to his right and makes half a stop
loops it up outside off, Dowrich blunts it
launches it off his pads to the midwicket boundary. West Indies are playing Dananjaya on line. If its outside off - defend. If its middle or leg - attack

stands tall against the short ball outside off and places it behind point. The pitch has slowed down considerably and that means taking quick wickets won't be the order of the day, especially for the quicks
gets behind a shortish delivery on and around off stump
squares him up by hitting the deck but again, since there isn't much pace left in the surface, Chase has time to adjust and keep the ball down to point
short ball, sliding down leg. No shot needed
leaves a short delivery outside off

finds that secret spot on the pitch which is still taking pity on these poor fast bowlers toiling again and produces sharp movement into the right-hander. And at pace. Chase is stuck in the crease, trying to flick, and is struck on the stomach
pushes it through down leg and Dowrich lets it go
shifts back and punches a good length ball to midwicket
plants his front leg outside off and works around it to send a good length ball past short leg's right
the length is short which allows Dowrich to hang back and read the turn off the pitch. As it happens, there is nothing so he blocks easily
legbreak on leg stump, Dowrich looks to flick it, but gets struck on the pad
sneaks in the legspinner's wrong 'un, which Dowrich does well to defend
short of a length outside off, Chase shuffles across and blocks
short, wide, gets on top of it and slaps to the right of point
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked through midwicket
short of a length, jags away off the deck, left alone
short of a length, uneven bounce again as it keeps low outside off with Chase shouldering arms
similar line and length and moving away again, Chase wants nothing to do with it
stays back and blocks
flighted on middle, steps down the track and lofts it straight over with a clean swing of the arms
shortish and spinning away, overcompensation after the six, Dowrich makes room and cuts away to sweeper cover
hits that ideal in-between length this time, Dowrich tucks to short leg who throws at the bowler's end after seeing Chase backing up too far and concedes overthrows
shuffles across and tucks to deep midwicket for a brace to bring up the 200. And some more runs courtesy overthrows as Dickwella fails to gather the throw from deep midwicket
lets it spin before turning it away into the on side
plays and misses as it keeps low outside off
short and some width, cut to backward point
shortish outside off, drags a pull to mid-on
short outside off, a little too close to it and he chops the cut to backward point
back of a length, holding its line outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, shuffles across and blocks to cover
stays back to a length ball and defends towards mid-on
length, spinning in, flicked to the on side
back of a length, spins into him, flicked to deep midwicket
back of a length, stays back and flicks to midwicket
short, spinning in towards off, backs away and cuts to cover
length ball, front-foot defense down the pitch
short and spinning in, cut to point
flighted on middle and leg, blocked
full and flighted outside off, defended
defends off the inside of the bat to the bowler
non-turning back of a length delivery, shuffles across and defends behind square on the off side
length ball that stays low, whipped away to deep midwicket
short outside off, cut to deep point
spins into the pads, nudged away towards fine leg
flighted outside off, driven to cover
defended down the pitch
nicely draws him forward with flight outside off and beats him with subtle turn
tucked off the pads towards fine leg
flighted on the stumps, blocked
shuffles across to block a length ball
shuffles and blocks towards mid-on
flighted on off, driven to long-on
spins the other way and he defends with an open face to point
back of a length, another shuffle-and-block
tries to pull this short one but gets tucked up for room
angles across a short one and cuts to deep point
full, driven towards the on side
pitched up outside off, driven to sweeper cover. Fifty of the stand
full on middle and leg, gets down and sweeps to backward square leg
pitched up on middle and leg, lofted down the ground, one-bounce to long-on
short and down the leg side, that's horribly off target
short, swings and misses as the bounce gets big
short of a length, angling into him, jumps and flicks to deep square leg
short of a length, shuffles across and defends
short of a length, cuts in, defended towards mid-on
shortish, bounces and comes into him, tries to tuck it but misses as the ball gets away for four byes
length, spinning in, tucked to square leg
gets a stride across and blocks into the off side
hangs back and opens the face towards third man
flighted on off, driven languidly past the extra cover fielder
flighted, driven along the ground wide of long-on
full on leg, turned away to the square leg umpire for a very quick one
full outside off, driven to point
short one that jags away slightly, Chase pokes at it and opens the face slightly to work it through third man
short, jumps and drops it to mid-on
full outside off, driven to extra cover
short of a length, left alone outside off
back of a length, tucked off the pads through backward square leg
flighted on the stumps, driven down the ground
length, spinning in, knocks it to midwicket
non-turning length ball, makes room and punches to deep point
advances down the ground and blocks back
gets down and finds backward square leg with his sweep
shuffles and blocks
full and tailing in, pushed off the inside of the bat towards mid-on
full, angled in on off, driven through cover
short and left alone outside off

an early wicket with the new ball, but this hardly has anything to do with the new ball. Just a tame shot. A fuller ball at shin height. Chase clips off the pads straight into the hands of short midwicket. Catching practice
full and tailing away, left alone
length that jags away, left alone
chops a short one into the ground as he tries to slap it hard
ooh, cuts away off the deck and keeps awfully low to beat the outside edge. Not far away from off-stump either
shortish, punched to point
short of a length, jags away, left alone
keeps the bat inside to one that jags away off a back of a length
fullish length, tails away late, left alone
good length ball slides down leg, past Holder's flick shot
corrects the line and places it outside off, Holder lets it go
the pace he wants to generate - 140 kph - makes his radar go wonky. A full one down leg, well wide of the flick shot
good length on off stump, keeps it out
ignores a pitched up delivery because it is too wide outside off
drives a full delivery outside off but doesn't quite time it
back of a length and outside off, Dowrich pokes at it, safely guiding to cover
brings him forward with the length and Dowrich drives into the covers
goes full but spills it down leg

drives ever so sweetly past mid-of's right and the timing is so good that even this heavy outfield can't stop it from reaching the boundary. Excellent shot, and really it's little more than a defensive push.
back of a length and outside off, lets it go
full and outside off, ease it to cover
presents the full face to a pitched up delivery on off stump
beats him with a lovely delivery, back of a length and nipping away off the seam. Holder tries to catch up with it but he has no chance.
knocks a fuller delivery on the pads to the left of mid-on. Concentrates on playing straight because of the variable bounce here, otherwise most players would have flicked this through midwicket
full and outside off, he leans in and presents a proper defence
drills it to cover, where Chandimal misfields to allow a single
blocks a full delivery to the left of cover
goes for a short-arm pull and, by placing the ball far enough to the left of midwicket, Dowrich gets to another fifty-plus score in this series
fulllish and outside off, no shot
good length, outside off, seaming away, but at 129 kph, it isn't too threatening. Dowrich lets it go easy

nicks it away! That's poor reward for a really good ball, ramping his pace up, angling the ball in at middle stump, urging the batsman to play the original angle. That's because this is an away seamer and when it shows its true colours, Dowrich is closed off, looking to hit to mid-on. Gets a leading edge and is lucky it runs away through no-man's land
full on off stump, keeps it out
squeezes the fuller delivery to the left of point
defends a back of a length delivery outside off

caught behind! Gorgeous work from Lakmal. And he's known for it with the new ball. Plants it at a dangerous area just outside the off stump - a place where Dowrich isn't sure whether he should be forward or back. As a result, he ends up reaching for the ball and the subtle movement away takes the outside edge through to Dickwella
sharp! The speedgun only says 127 but the bouncer makes a pretzel out of Bishoo, making him leap up and sway away lest he wants his head knocked over
follows up with the sucker ball, full and wide outside off, Bishoo doesn't bite
blocks a back of a length delivery on off stump. Bishoo's hanging back, worried about the short ball
covers the line of this shortish delivery outside off and pats it to the right of cover
digs it in but Bishoo is expecting this line of attack; drops his wrists and gets out of the way as the ball sails over leg stump
keeps to his crease and punches a short ball to mid-on
shifts around the wicket for a full ball on off stump. Bishoo keeps it out
finds the yawning gap between mid-off and point
good length and outside off, no shot
full on middle Bishoo taps towards mid-on, where a misfield helps him pinch a single
drives on the up but places it well enough to get a single through the covers
flicks the one angled from wide of the crease and into the base of middle and off stump. Doesn't quite beat the bowler
beats him with a delightfully full ball outside off. It pitches and nips away just enough past Holder's tentative poke. Still fun being a fast bowler out here
on the pads and Holder works it off the back foot to deep square leg
flirts with a good length ball outside off and is lucky not to nick it through
straightens off a length, tucked to square leg
shortish, worked off the hips to fine leg
fullish outside off, blocked into the covers
tries to whip this back of a length delivery across the line and gets hit on the pad
jags away off the deck as he defends off the outside of the bat towards gully
that's a loose shot outside off. Chases a wide fuller one and gets a thick outside edge to second slip. Simple catch for Mendis
short, goes over the arched back of Holder and the keeper's head
short of a length, gets big on Holder who keeps his bat inside
fuller 136kmph delivery that stops on him, Holder chips it in the air but it drops short of cover
back of a length on middle, bunted down the pitch
length outside off, Holder keeps his bat inside the line
back of a length, keeps low outside off as Holder shoulders arms
length outside off, again keeps the bat inside
fuller, pushed down the pitch
jumps and blocks off the backfoot
slashes at a wide one that jags away and gets a thick edge through the gully region
gentle length ball outside off, punched out to sweeper cover
short of a length, holding its line, left alone
swings away from a fullish length, dangerously reaches out for it and misses
flicked to midwicket
shortish, jumps and flicks to the on side
short of a length, moves across and tries to tuck but misses
fullish length outside off, drives away from the body and knocks it to third man off the outside of the bat
shuffles across to a fuller one and works it through the leg side
short of a length, shoulders arms as it jags away
short of good length, angled down the leg side, tries to pull and nearly gets a glove to the keeper
length outside off, blocked into the covers
gets extra bounce from a back of a length and Holder is culpable of sticking his bat out away from the body, gets an outside edge that settles into the hands of Dickwella
back of a length outside off, blocked from the crease
asking for a catch, not given. SL have no reviews left. Cummins takes his eyes off trying to duck under a short ball. Might have just grazed the back. And forearm, too, perhaps
full outside off, driven down the pitch
full, flicked off the pads through square leg. They take three by the time the ball can be pulled back
short, gets under it easily
gets the front leg out of the way and swats a short of a length delivery between mid-on and midwicket
backs away trying to force a drive and gets beaten
another short ball for Cummins to get under
third bouncer of the over, well over shoulder-height, and called a wide
length on leg, blocked down the pitch
back of a length, jags away, stays away and flashes to get beaten
fullish, swings away, blocked down the pitch
short, gets under it easily
back of a length, tucks to the on side for a quick one
swats at a short of a length delivery and manages no contact
advances down the ground and swings and misses
stays put and tries to smoke a short ball over mid-off. Succeeds in much the same way as Tom does in catching Jerry
shuffles across to the fullish delivery outside off and plops it through the covers
clears his front leg and looks to peel Kumara over his own head. No luck.
nice and full on leg stump, Cummins keeps it out

ducks into a short ball, hoping it would rise over his head, but the pitch doesn't quite allow that and he takes a blow flush on the helmet grille. Umpire Gould, from square leg, comes in to check on Cummins. Soon so would the physio. Good news is Cummins is standing, and smiling too. Straps the lid back on - which is when he's told he'd do better to get a replacement

yorker on leg stump, Cummins takes care of it, and then suffers a verbal volley from the angry fast bowler. Umpire Dar tells Sri Lanka to keep calm after the 21-year old quick attempts to throw down the stumps when Cummins wasn't looking for a single. Gould has a little convo (including finger-pointing) with Dickwella as they change ends
back of a length on off stump, blocks it
full toss outside off, he swishes and misses
shortish on middle, knocks it down
wallops a length ball outside off to the point boundary with outrageous authority. The sparse local crowd looks quite thrilled.
appeal for lbw as a fuller delivery pins Roach on the back leg. No footwork from the tailender, but it appears to hit him a bit too high
wants to go downtown but Lakmal's away swing won't let him. Beaten
walks away from the line of this bouncer, but Kumara follows him. Cummins just about protects his body with a straight bat and then has to rush back in his crease with short leg lurking
another bouncer, climbing past the ear of the ducking bastman. Hostile stuff from Kumara, that too late in the day. He's a gem!
clears his front leg and swipes a length ball on off stump out to deep midwicket

knocks him out with a yorker! Roach, with his tendency to walk across his stumps, is a sitting duck against Kumara as he goes full and straight. The ball nips past the inside edge, clips the front pad nice and low and would've crashed into leg stump
bouncer at the last man in. Gabriel avoids it
wants to slog a back of a length delivery over mid-on. It's on him too quickly for such shenanigans
looks for the yorker on leg stump. Nails the length, but the line is just a tiny bit awry. Cummins is backing away again, but can't put bat to ball
smears a middle-stump half-volley down the ground to the long-on boundary. Only the second off Lakmal this innings
swats the slower ball from outside off down to long-on
cuts in off the deck and only just misses off stump. Gabriel is so late on his hack through the covers
good length on off stump, Gabriel defends it solidly
takes the pace off and pitches it up, Gabriel drills it straight over the stumps at the bowler's end
pulls a short ball on middle and leg to midwicket
slogs a fuller delivery on middle and leg out to deep square leg, mostly off the inside edge, to bring up the 300.

sensational catch by first slip running back. It's a top-edge as Gabriel looks to pull a short ball outside off. De Silva tracks it down superbly, even accounting for the wind - a really strong wind in Gros Islet - as he dives to his right to hold on and end the innings
back of a length and outside off from around the wicket. Kusal knocks it down towards cover
looks to short-arm pull a ball coming up towards his ribs. Can't pull it off.
lofts the length ball with the angle away to the square leg boundary. That's a favourite shot of his, often seen when he's demolishing attacks in one-day cricket
spears it through the covers, lovely timing on the shot, but this outfield is just such a Scrooge
plays so far down the wrong line as he looks to launch a fuller delivery outside off over wide mid-on. Beaten on the leading edge!
swats a shortish delivery outside off to the long-off boundary. Kusal's starting play in fifth gear.
crunches a shortish delivery outside off towards point
times the fuller delivery quite sweetly past cover's right. Those are his first runs in Test cricket.
drifts down leg as Udawatte tries to flick it away behind square leg. No contact
nudges a back of a length delivery to the left of short leg
looks to use Gabriel's pace and work him to fine leg, but can't catch up with the 146 kph delivery darting to the keeper
there we go - the ball slides into his body, he's able to shift it inside the line and flick to long leg. Finally.
good length ball, pitching outside off, testing if Udawatte wants to drive away from his body. He isn't
shifts the line wider outside off and gets the same no-response response from the batsman
short and wide outside off, Udawatte holds fire

delicious stuff! Bowling from around the wicket, he demands left-hand batsmen to play at wider deliveries. Especially of this variety - full and drivable. Udawatte tries to but is beaten by the away movement
good length but too wide outside off to interest the batsman
shoulders arms to a fullish delivery outside off
stands up tall and slaps a shortish delivery outside off to the left of point. Good effort from Chase to keep it to just a single
hits the deck hard and gets the ball to rise up towards Udawatte's chest. The batsman, though, very calmly blunts it
good decision to avoid this rising delivery, Udawatte shoving his hands as high as they would go above his head and watching the ball skip away down the leg side
taps a back of a length delivery on middle past short leg's right
pulls the bouncer at 144 kph behind square leg
flays at a short ball at 145 kph outside off, but meets with only air
full and wide outside off, Kusal goes hard at it but again makes no contact
back of a length and outside off, easy leave
chops a short and wide ball to cover
pitches it up on middle, Kusal defends
launches a length ball on off stump down the ground. No timing though. Barely goes halfway to the boundary
shortish and outside off, knocks it down to cover

lovely line - around the fourth stump - and the length asks for the drive as well. Udawatte has to be forward, but he doesn't get there, not with Gabriel's pace. Pokes at it and is comfortably beaten by the away seam
knocks a good length ball on middle down towards a non-existent mid-on
cuts him in half with a beat. It's fast. it's cramping him. Then cuts in off the pitch too. Kusal tries to cut but is beaten on the inside edge. Lucky 'cause he could easily have dragged on.
top edge sails over the slips! Hard slash meant to go over point still ends up beyond the boundary
goes for the bouncer but not only does it wander waywardly down leg, he's also overstepped
punches a back of a length delivery to cover
gets up off his toes in an effort to work a short ball through midwicket. Gabriel's extra bounce doesn't quite allow for that. So the big quick gives a withering stare
short and way way wide outside off. Udawatte ignores it. The umpire, however, cannot
teaser on and around off stump, Udawatte does well to avoid its trappings. Oh, Holder's overstepped. This has been a terrible show from West Indies
goes around the wicket for a shortish delivery too far outside off to interest a batsman playing for stumps
full on leg stump, Udawatte blocks to midwicket
fullish on off stump, knocks it down safely
good length ball on off stump, blocks
fullish on off stump, defends it.
pushes a length ball down to the long-on boundary. That's a neat way to end an indifferent over
pushes a shortish delivery to mid-off and pinches a quick single. Then they also have an overthrow for the taking.
shortish and outside off, slaps it to mid-off
digs it in and it wanders way down leg.

nicks off! He finally finds the right line - on off stump - and the right length - the kind that pins the batsman in his crease. Kusal tries to defend, but a hint of away movement secures a thick outside edge through to the keeper
short and outside of, Rajitha lets it go.
good length, nipping back in at the night-watchman. Rajitha is late on the shot and gets struck high on the pad
starts with a bouncer, Udawatte doesn't need to play. West Indies wasting the new ball
another short ball, which Udawatte spots early and sways away
back of a length and outside off, lets it go
shortish on leg stump, Udawatte taps it to short leg

past gully, leaping to his left! Very very difficult for Shai Hope. He is at full stretch, both hands searching for the ball as Udawatte indulges in an errant drive on the up. See, fuller ball creating opportunities

huge appeal for lbw but Umpire Dar probably reckons it's pitched outside leg. Mini-conference among the West Indies players and at the end of it, Holder reviews. Excellent delivery from Cummins though, pitching the new ball up, trapping the batsman in the crease. Udawatte plays around his front pad a little bit but he can bat on because HawkEye confirms it pitches outside leg
Full, outside off and left alone first up. Carefully lets the day's first ball through to Dowrich
back of a length outside off, and jags inwards after pitching. Goes from near his face and through to the keeper. Rajitha does well to sway out of the ball's way
back of a length outside off again. It's not in the stump's line, so Rajitha chooses not to play at it

late reaction from the umpire, but given! Fuller ball now, and lands on middle. Rajitha's too slow to get his bat down, and the ball crashes into his back leg. Stayed low too, and the ball would've definitely hit leg stump
full outside off, and shoulders his arms this time
length ball outside off, and angling inwards. Fended off the front foot
around the wicket, and lands outside off. Blocked off the front foot
full outside off, and pushed off the front foot to cover point. Fielder intercepts
full on off, and tailing in slightly. Udawatte prods forward, and caresses this down the ground. Sends the umpire skipping, and the ball races away to the straight boundary. Beautiful
full, but wider outside off. Confidently shoulders his arms
length ball outside off, and shaping further away. He shoulders his arms
short of a length, keeps low as it cuts into him and he swings and misses
short of length on off, jumps and blocks
length, curving in late from outside off, left alone
good length, cutting in towards off, defended
length, cuts in on middle, blocked down the pitch
short of good length, de Silva shoulders arms as it bounces extra outside off
full outside off, pushed through the off side
shot! Good stride across and just leans into a drive between the gap at covers. Two fielders chase it down and keeps it inside the boundary
fullish, some movement away from the left-hander, gets the foot across and defends solidly
shortish around off, turns it away behind square leg
shuffles across and blocks a back of a length delivery into the off side
full and angling in on middle and leg, blocked
short of a length, shuffles across and works it behind square
full outside off, drilled off the inside of the bat towards mid-on
short of a length outside off, left alone
jumps to block a short of a length delivery

that's a poor stroke. de Silva falls for the bait and chases a very wide delivery. No effort to get behind the line or throw his weight behind it. Just stands and slashes and gets an outside edge to first slip who gathers it at chest height
short of a length, rides the bounce and tucks to midwicket
full, angled in and jagging away late, left alone
full and straightening late, pushes away from the body towards point
full and angled in and straightening late, Mendis makes a late call to keep his bat inside the line
full, angled into middle and leg, clipped past the right of mid-on
fullish length, blocked down the pitch
length, holding its line outside off, left alone
fulish, leaves him further very late after he lets it go. Got to bowl closer
length ball, holds its line, left alone
length, straight and pretty wide outside off, left alone
dipping yorker outside off, dug out to the off side
short of good length, rises considerably as he lets it go outside off

uh oh! That's a soft dismissal! Pitched right up outside off, looked like he rolled his fingers over the seam and Udawatte presses forward early and chips a catch straight into the hands of short cover, where Bishoo takes a catch reverse-cupped over his head. Sri Lanka effectively 1 for 4
chest-high short ball, tucked behind square
full outside off, left alone
full and angled in, tries to tuck and wears it on the pad
short of a length, cuts away, reaches out and misses
short of good length, jumps and blocks
short of a length, jumps and defends in front of off
tucked to square leg
short ball, jumps and keeps it out
short, rising sharply outside off, not bothered with
left alone outside off
full, tailing in, drilled off the inside of the bat towards midwicket
length ball outside off, pushed down the ground with sublime timing. Just presents the full face of the bat
short outside off, jumps and steers it through point
length ball outside off, left alone
good length outside off, gets on top and keeps it out
short of a length, keeps low outside off, turns it away to midwicket
short outside off, jumps and slaps it through point
short of a length, opens the face to point
length on off, shuffles across and blocks
short of a length, nudged into the on side
short, caught in two minds as he swivels around and decides not to go for the pull
short of a length outside off, gets on top and knocks it to extra cover
short of good length outside off, jumps and blocks
good length, angles in towards off, defended
length around off, defends with bat close to pad
length, curves away outside off, left alone
length, shuffles across and blocks
short of length, cuts in, blocked
fullish length outside off, defended
short of a length, cuts in, jumps and tucks to midwicket
full outside off, drilled to extra cover
extremely full and dipping outside off, squeezed out to the off side
short, gets over middle and he ducks under
keeps low as he fends it away to the off side on his toes
sprays it horribly down the leg side and gets past Dowrich diving to his left
back of a length, moves away, Chandimal shoulders arms
length, swings away, covers for the movement and blocks into the off side
full on middle and leg, blocked to mid-on
in the air and short of the fielder. Superb bouncer, squares him up and gets a glove that falls short of gully running forward
short of a length outside off, blocked to the covers
cuts in from a back of a length and hits the high part of the pad as he looks to flick
back of a length, keeps low, flicked into the on side
driven uppishly but in the gap. Gets a stride across and flays the fuller ball through the gap at cover
chest-hunting short ball, angling in and cramping the batsman. He is rushed into a hook, top-edges it, but it does not carry to long leg
back of a length and angling down the leg side, Mendis does not quite connect with a glance. Did that kiss the thigh or bat on its way to Dowrich? Holder has overstepped, however
full and outside off, Mendis plays inside the line and lets it go
full and angling in at off, Mendis covers the line in defence
pitched up and outside off, Mendis stretches out, his front foot meet the pitch of the ball. Driven through the line but straight to mid-off
short on middle, fended back
keeps it short, aimed at the body, Mendis fends it off again
banged in short, down the leg side, 136ks, left alone
lifter on middle, ducks under it
Chandimal gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches it on the up to short cover
short inducker from wide of the crease, finishes on off, jabbed back to the bowler off the back foot
back of a length and angling into a defensive push to short midwicket
short and darted into the hips, clipped with the angle to fine leg for one
dangled up on off, hint of turn, presses forward and smothers it
dragged down outside off, spins away, flashed to short cover. Scoring opportunity missed
darted short and wide, punched up to short cover
whipped against the break to the right of mid-on
punched off the back foot, hits short leg
here comes Kusal Mendis: down the track, he does not get close enough to the pitch but still dares to whip it against the break through midwicket. The ball rolls away to the boundary. Whippage
short and angling into the body from over the stumps, he hops and fends it away to the leg side
back of a length on middle, blocked
Chandimal throws his hands at a drive but misses the line of this half-volley outside off
Chandimal stretches out, meets the pitch of this full ball and drives to cover
short and outside off, ignored
pitched up and angling in at off or just a shade outside off, driven off the front foot to mid-off
short legbreak outside off, rocks back and pulls, short leg throws himself to his left and takes some pace off the ball
looped up on middle, marches down the track and laces a drive to long-off
tossed-up legbreak outside off, Chandimal uses his feet again and laces it through the covers. He hares back for the second
short and breaks away outside off, Mendis reaches out for the ball and ends up carving a cut to cover
dropped short and outside off, cracked off the back foot but can't get it past extra cover. There's a short cover in place as well
back of a length and spins away outside off, Mendis goes on the back foot and punches with the break to backward point

kicks up from a back of a length, the extra bounce means Chandimal cops a blow on the glove as he aims to fend it off. The ball rolls away to point. Mendis, meanwhile, strays out of the crease in search of a risky single and there's a direct hit at the non-striker's end but Mendis undoes his steps in time
short and banged down on leg, Chandimal ducks under it. Sails over to Dowrich and called wide
back of a length and skidding in on off, tucks up Chandimal for room, played back to Holder
another prancing delivery, fended off the chest towards fine leg
follows short/back-of-a-length deliveries with a full ball on off, Mendis is concentrating. He reads the length, gets forward, and blocks to cover
wide of the crease, angling into a forward defensive
dug in short and hits the splice as Mendis blocks off the back foot
shortish and spins away outside off, lashed to cover off the back foot
uses his feet to smother a length-ball legbreak
tossed up and spins away outside off, Chandimal uses his feet again but is nowhere close to the pitch. He ends up slicing it across over extra cover
grip and turn, dabbed with the break to backward point off the front foot
